ADBE_2024Q4_69.speaker: David Wadhwani

ADBE_2024Q4_74.summary: Adobe's AI Assistant has been a significant addition, allowing users to have conversations about the documents they view without needing extensive security and governance reviews.

ADBE_2024Q4_75.original_quote: So it's just another way much like AI assistance is of monetizing it.

ADBE_2024Q4_76.original_quote: So we are looking at leveraging the power of this AI foundation in all the activities.

ADBE_2024Q4_77.summary: Adobe is experiencing significant momentum in its Creative Cloud business due to innovations related to AI, contributing to a diverse portfolio of offerings and customers.

AMD_2023Q1_149.original_quote: We have a very strong financial model, and we'll continue to invest in our long-term strategic priorities, including accelerating our AI offerings to drive sustainable value creation over the long term.
AMD_2023Q1_149.summary: AMD is continuing to invest in its long-term strategic priorities, which includes accelerating its AI offerings to create sustainable value over time.

AMD_2023Q1_156.speaker: Ross Seymore
AMD_2023Q1_156.original_quote: And pivoting for my follow-up on the AI side and MI300.
AMD_2023Q1_156.summary: The company is pivoting to focus on AI and its MI300 product.

AMD_2023Q1_158.speaker: Timothy Arcuri
AMD_2023Q1_158.original_quote: Lisa, there was a lot more talk on this call about AI.
AMD_2023Q1_158.summary: The quote indicates that there was increased discussion about AI during the call.

AMD_2023Q1_157.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q1_157.original_quote: In terms of generative AI, we believe we offer a strong value proposition from a hardware perspective, particularly in terms of performance relative to cost, which indicates high market demand.
AMD_2023Q1_157.summary: AMD believes it offers a strong value proposition for generative AI from a hardware perspective, emphasizing performance relative to cost and indicating high market demand.

AMD_2023Q1_161.speaker: Jean Hu
AMD_2023Q1_161.original_quote: First, we have made substantial investments, particularly in networking and AI.
AMD_2023Q1_161.summary: AMD has made substantial investments in networking and AI.

AMD_2023Q1_155.speaker: Harlan Sur
AMD_2023Q1_155.original_quote: And in terms of other opportunities, there appears to be this trend towards more of your cloud and hyperscale customers opting to do their own silicon solutions around accelerated compute or AI offload ends, right?
AMD_2023Q1_155.summary: AMD is observing a trend where cloud and hyperscale customers are choosing to develop their own silicon solutions for accelerated computing or AI offloading.

AMD_2023Q1_159.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q1_159.original_quote: And the way you should think about our AI portfolio is it's really a broad AI portfolio across client, edge, as well as cloud.
AMD_2023Q1_159.summary: AMD is presenting its AI portfolio as a broad offering that spans client devices, edge computing, and cloud solutions.

AMD_2023Q1_154.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q1_154.original_quote: I would say we have been focused on AI as a strategic priority for AMD for a considerable time.
AMD_2023Q1_154.summary: AMD has been focused on AI as a strategic priority for a considerable time.

AMD_2023Q1_160.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q1_160.original_quote: And then we'll have the beginnings of our MI300 ramp in the fourth quarter for both supercomputing and some early AI workloads.
AMD_2023Q1_160.summary: AMD will begin ramping up its MI300 product in the fourth quarter, targeting both supercomputing and early AI workloads.

AMD_2023Q1_162.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q1_162.original_quote: So both the mix to cloud as well as the R&D expense has increased just given the large opportunities that we have across the data center and especially AI.
AMD_2023Q1_162.summary: AMD is increasing its R&D expenses due to the large opportunities in the data center market, particularly in AI.

AMD_2023Q1_163.speaker: Harsh Kumar
AMD_2023Q1_163.original_quote: I wanted to ask you about your views on the inferencing market for generative AI 3+.
AMD_2023Q1_163.summary: The analyst is inquiring about AMD's perspective on the inferencing market specifically related to generative AI.

AMD_2023Q2_168.speaker: Jean Hu
AMD_2023Q2_168.original_quote: Importantly, our leadership product portfolio, Datacenter and AI investment priorities, and financial strengths position us well for long-term growth.
AMD_2023Q2_168.summary: AMD is focusing on its leadership product portfolio and AI investment priorities to ensure long-term growth.

AMD_2023Q1_166.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q1_166.original_quote: So as we said earlier, we've done some really good work on MI250 with AI and large language models.
AMD_2023Q1_166.summary: AMD has made significant progress on the MI250 in relation to AI and large language models.

AMD_2023Q1_165.speaker: Harsh Kumar
AMD_2023Q1_165.original_quote: But specifically, I was curious if you could talk about any wins or any kind of successes or success stories you might have on the generative AI side with MI300 or 250 series?
AMD_2023Q1_165.summary: The analyst is inquiring about any successes or wins related to generative AI using AMD's MI300 or 250 series products.

AMD_2023Q2_167.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q2_167.original_quote: On the hardware side, we announced our new Instinct MI300X GPUs designed to be the world's most advanced accelerators for generative AI.
AMD_2023Q2_167.summary: AMD announced the new Instinct MI300X GPUs, which are designed to be the world's most advanced accelerators specifically for generative AI.

AMD_2023Q2_170.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q2_170.original_quote: On the positive side, we are seeing an acceleration in AI demand in a few ways.
AMD_2023Q2_170.summary: AMD is observing an acceleration in AI demand in several ways.

AMD_2023Q1_164.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q1_164.original_quote: The highest demand at the moment is for generative AI and large language model inferencing, which requires GPUs due to their ability to support training of the most advanced models.
AMD_2023Q1_164.summary: AMD is experiencing high demand for generative AI and large language model inferencing, which necessitates the use of GPUs to support the training of advanced models.

AMD_2023Q2_169.speaker: Matt Ramsay
AMD_2023Q2_169.original_quote: And your company is in a great position to participate on both sides of that on the CPU strength, and obviously in the AI space.
AMD_2023Q2_169.summary: AMD is positioned to participate in both CPU strength and the AI space.

AMD_2023Q2_171.speaker: Matt Ramsay
AMD_2023Q2_171.original_quote: Your company is aggressively trying to ramp both the hardware and the software side of the MI300 programs to support AI.
AMD_2023Q2_171.summary: AMD is aggressively ramping both the hardware and software components of the MI300 programs to support AI.

AMD_2023Q2_172.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q2_172.original_quote: If I could share some insights on our customer engagements, there's a strong interest in our AI solutions from various tiers, including major hyperscalers, large enterprises, and a new group of AI-focused companies that are innovative in their use of AI technologies.
AMD_2023Q2_172.summary: AMD is experiencing strong interest in its AI solutions from major hyperscalers, large enterprises, and innovative AI-focused companies.

AMD_2023Q2_174.speaker: Jean Hu
AMD_2023Q2_174.original_quote: But we are investing in AI, Datacenter, and the strategic priorities we have which generate a much higher return on investment.
AMD_2023Q2_174.summary: AMD is investing in AI and datacenter initiatives that are aligned with their strategic priorities, which they believe will yield a higher return on investment.

AMD_2023Q2_177.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q2_177.original_quote: So, I think maybe let me take a step back and just talk about sort of our investments in AI.
AMD_2023Q2_177.summary: AMD is discussing its investments in AI.

AMD_2023Q2_173.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q2_173.original_quote: Furthermore, MI300X will start ramping up with large AI customers, along with MI250s being adopted by various customers for specific AI workloads that do not involve the largest language models or parameters.
AMD_2023Q2_173.summary: AMD is ramping up the MI300X for large AI customers and has seen the MI250s adopted by various customers for specific AI workloads that do not involve the largest language models or parameters.

AMD_2023Q2_175.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q2_175.original_quote: export controls, but we do believe there's an opportunity to develop products for our customer set in China that is looking for AI solutions, and we'll continue to work in that direction.
AMD_2023Q2_175.summary: AMD is developing products aimed at customers in China who are seeking AI solutions and plans to continue working in that direction.

AMD_2023Q2_176.speaker: Vivek Arya
AMD_2023Q2_176.original_quote: And for my follow-up, just kind of a broader question on AI accelerators in the commercial market, so I'm excluding the Supercomputing, the El Capitan projects, et cetera.
AMD_2023Q2_176.summary: The analyst is asking a broader question about AI accelerators specifically in the commercial market, excluding supercomputing projects like El Capitan.

AMD_2023Q2_182.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q2_182.original_quote: I will say the difference in AI deployments is, I think, customers are willing to go very quickly.
AMD_2023Q2_182.summary: AMD observes that customers are willing to rapidly adopt AI deployments.

AMD_2023Q2_179.speaker: Christopher Rolland
AMD_2023Q2_179.original_quote: Hey guys, thanks for the question and more on the MI300 opportunity that you guys called out as a multibillion dollar growth opportunity, I was wondering if perhaps you could put a timeframe around that multibillion dollar opportunity but more specifically, have you guys ported over MI300 LLMs to MI
AMD_2023Q2_179.summary: AMD is discussing the MI300 opportunity, which is identified as a multibillion dollar growth opportunity, and the potential for porting MI300 LLMs to MI.

AMD_2023Q2_178.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q2_178.original_quote: So, I think there was a question earlier about how much of the MI300 revenue was AI centric versus let's call it supercomputing centric.
AMD_2023Q2_178.summary: AMD is discussing the revenue generated from the MI300, differentiating between AI-centric revenue and supercomputing-centric revenue.

AMD_2023Q2_180.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q2_180.original_quote: For AI applications, what we're seeing now is MI300X.
AMD_2023Q2_180.summary: AMD is highlighting the MI300X as a product specifically designed for AI applications.

AMD_2024Q3_185.speaker: Dr. Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q3_185.original_quote: Turning to our Data Center AI business, Data Center GPU revenue ramped as MI300X adoption expanded with cloud, OEM, and AI customers.
AMD_2024Q3_185.summary: AMD is experiencing a revenue increase in their Data Center AI business as the adoption of the MI300X GPU expands among cloud, OEM, and AI customers.

AMD_2024Q3_186.speaker: Jean Hu
AMD_2024Q3_186.original_quote: Importantly, we are making a strategic investment to position AMD as the end-to-end AI infrastructure leader and drive long-term profitable growth.
AMD_2024Q3_186.summary: AMD is making a strategic investment to establish itself as the end-to-end AI infrastructure leader and to drive long-term profitable growth.

AMD_2023Q2_183.speaker: Harsh Kumar
AMD_2023Q2_183.original_quote: On my second one, can you help us think a little bit about the generative AI spend, let's say, if you can side press some kind of metric, and so, how many dollars of spend today are you seeing from your customers on generative AI for let's say each dollar of regular server CPU spend?
AMD_2023Q2_183.summary: The analyst is asking AMD to provide insights on the spending metrics related to generative AI from their customers in comparison to regular server CPU spending.

AMD_2023Q2_181.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q2_181.original_quote: And as we go into next year for the AI specific applications, we are more heavily weighted towards MI300X, just given sort of where the software is written.
AMD_2023Q2_181.summary: AMD is focusing more on the MI300X for AI-specific applications as they move into next year, based on the current state of software development.

AMD_2024Q3_189.speaker: Dr. Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q3_189.original_quote: So overall, we have a very strong top-to-bottom stack, and we do see some strength in the overall server market, which adds to some of the AI opportunity that we have.
AMD_2024Q3_189.summary: AMD sees strength in the overall server market, which contributes to the AI opportunities they have.

AMD_2023Q2_184.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q2_184.original_quote: There is no doubt that the need for generative AI solutions is extremely high, and significant computing capacity needs to be established.
AMD_2023Q2_184.summary: AMD acknowledges the high demand for generative AI solutions and emphasizes the need to establish significant computing capacity to meet this demand.

AMD_2024Q3_191.speaker: Dr. Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q3_191.original_quote: We believe that there will be strong AI content on CPUs, and that helps Turin as well.
AMD_2024Q3_191.summary: AMD believes there will be strong AI content on their CPUs, which will benefit their Turin product line.

AMD_2024Q3_188.speaker: Dr. Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q3_188.original_quote: I think we've done very well with our launches this year, both on the desktop Zen 5 launches as well as the notebook AI PC launches.
AMD_2024Q3_188.summary: AMD has successfully launched both desktop Zen 5 products and AI PCs for notebooks this year.

AMD_2024Q3_187.speaker: Dr. Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q3_187.original_quote: Regarding 2025, we feel positive about the market based on our discussions with customers, who are significantly investing to build the infrastructure needed for various AI workloads.
AMD_2024Q3_187.summary: AMD feels positive about the market for 2025 based on discussions with customers who are significantly investing in building infrastructure for various AI workloads.

AMD_2024Q3_196.speaker: Dr. Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q3_196.original_quote: There is good momentum around AI PCs.
AMD_2024Q3_196.summary: AMD is experiencing positive momentum in the market for AI PCs.

AMD_2024Q3_195.speaker: Dr. Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q3_195.original_quote: So, look, there are lots of opportunities across the set of AI workloads.
AMD_2024Q3_195.summary: AMD is identifying numerous opportunities within various AI workloads.

AMD_2024Q3_192.speaker: Dr. Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q3_192.original_quote: We introduced our desktop products, including the Zen 5 and Ryzen 9000 series, as well as our next-generation AI PC Ryzen AI 300 products.
AMD_2024Q3_192.summary: AMD introduced its next-generation AI PC Ryzen AI 300 products as part of its desktop offerings, which also include the Zen 5 and Ryzen 9000 series.

AMD_2024Q3_193.speaker: Dr. Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q3_193.original_quote: For example, Meta mentioned expanding from inference on their large language models with Llama 3.1 to training workloads, and Microsoft has been an excellent partner in this journey.
AMD_2024Q3_193.summary: AMD is involved in supporting Meta's expansion from inference to training workloads for their large language models, specifically Llama 3.1, with the help of Microsoft as a partner.

AMD_2024Q3_194.speaker: Joe Moore
AMD_2024Q3_194.original_quote: I wonder if you could talk about the $5 billion of AI revenue, how that breaks down between training and inference, if you're able to assess that and just I know you sort of started off with most of the traction in inference, but you've seen some traction on the training side.
AMD_2024Q3_194.summary: AMD generated $5 billion in AI revenue, with initial traction primarily in inference and some recent traction in training.

AMD_2024Q4_200.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q4_200.original_quote: I mean I believe that the demand for AI compute is strong.
AMD_2024Q4_200.summary: AMD believes that the demand for AI compute is strong.

AMD_2024Q3_190.speaker: Ben Reitzes
AMD_2024Q3_190.original_quote: With the momentum you mentioned, is it the right CPU for GPUs, and are hyperscalers particularly appreciative of the ability to consolidate and make more space for AI equipment?
AMD_2024Q3_190.summary: The quote inquires whether the CPU is suitable for GPUs and if hyperscalers value the ability to consolidate and create more space for AI equipment.

AMD_2024Q4_203.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q4_203.original_quote: And on the notebook side, we also saw a number of our OEM partners launching new AI PCs with the slew of new bulk mobile part numbers that we announced at CES.
AMD_2024Q4_203.summary: AMD saw several OEM partners launching new AI PCs that feature the new bulk mobile part numbers announced at CES.

AMD_2024Q4_198.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q4_198.original_quote: 2024 was an outstanding year, as we accelerated our AI hardware roadmap to deliver an annual cadence of new Instinct accelerators, expanded our ROCm software suite with significant uplifts in inferencing and training performance, built strong customer relationships with key industry leaders, and del
AMD_2024Q4_198.summary: AMD accelerated its AI hardware roadmap to deliver new Instinct accelerators annually and expanded its ROCm software suite to enhance inferencing and training performance.

AMD_2024Q4_199.speaker: Jean Hu
AMD_2024Q4_199.original_quote: We expanded gross margin by 300 basis points and achieved earnings per share growth of 25% while investing aggressively in AI to fuel our future growth.
AMD_2024Q4_199.summary: AMD is investing aggressively in AI to fuel future growth while achieving a 300 basis point expansion in gross margin and 25% growth in earnings per share.

AMD_2024Q3_197.speaker: Harsh Kumar
AMD_2024Q3_197.original_quote: In the coming year, let's say, 2025, your key competitor will take most of the TAM of the AI market, the GPU market, rough count, they'll take in something like $50 billion, $60 billion, you'll get another $5 billion to $10 billion, call it.
AMD_2024Q3_197.summary: The quote discusses the expected market share of AMD and its competitor in the AI GPU market for 2025, estimating that the competitor will capture $50 billion to $60 billion, while AMD is projected to gain $5 billion to $10 billion.

AMD_2024Q4_202.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q4_202.original_quote: And from a first half, second half statement, as I mentioned, we have some new important AI design wins that are going to be deployed with and MI300 and MI325 in the first half of the year.
AMD_2024Q4_202.summary: AMD has secured new important AI design wins that will be deployed with the MI300 and MI325 in the first half of the year.

AMD_2024Q4_204.speaker: Harlan Sur
AMD_2024Q4_204.original_quote: Networking is a very critical part of the AI infrastructure becoming even more important.
AMD_2024Q4_204.summary: AMD states that networking is a critical component of AI infrastructure and is becoming increasingly important.

AMD_2024Q4_205.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q4_205.original_quote: Networking is an extremely important part of the AI solution, and it's an area that we have been investing and spending quite a bit of effort with our customers and our partners jointly.
AMD_2024Q4_205.summary: AMD is investing and collaborating with customers and partners in the networking aspect of AI solutions.

AMD_2024Q4_201.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q4_201.original_quote: I think the DeepSeek announcements, Allen Institute as well as some of the Stargate announcements talk about just how much the rate and pace of innovation that's happening in the AI world.
AMD_2024Q4_201.summary: AMD is highlighting the DeepSeek announcements and Stargate announcements to emphasize the rapid pace of innovation occurring in the AI sector.

AMD_2025Q1_209.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q1_209.original_quote: So we're excited about the overall AI business.
AMD_2025Q1_209.summary: AMD is excited about the overall AI business.

AMD_2024Q4_206.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q4_206.original_quote: In the early part of 2024, there was a slight decrease in investments on the CPU side as companies focused their spending on AI initiatives.
AMD_2024Q4_206.summary: AMD observed a slight decrease in investments in CPUs as companies redirected their spending towards AI initiatives in early 2024.

AMD_2025Q1_207.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q1_207.original_quote: Turning to our data center AI business, revenue increased by a significant double-digit percentage year-over-year, as MI325X shipments ramp to support new enterprise and cloud deployments.
AMD_2025Q1_207.summary: AMD's data center AI business saw a significant double-digit percentage increase in revenue year-over-year, driven by the ramp-up of MI325X shipments for new enterprise and cloud deployments.

AMD_2025Q1_210.speaker: Vivek Arya
AMD_2025Q1_210.original_quote: And then longer term, Lisa, in the past you described I believe almost a $500 billion or so addressable market for AI accelerators.
AMD_2025Q1_210.summary: AMD has identified an addressable market of approximately $500 billion for AI accelerators.

AMD_2025Q1_208.speaker: Jean Hu
AMD_2025Q1_208.original_quote: Looking forward, despite ongoing macro and trade policy related uncertainties, we believe the investment we are making will position us well to address the large growth opportunities ahead as AI expands the use of high-performance computing across all our end markets.
AMD_2025Q1_208.summary: AMD is making investments to position itself to capitalize on growth opportunities as AI expands the use of high-performance computing across all its end markets.

AMD_2025Q1_212.speaker: Joe Moore
AMD_2025Q1_212.original_quote: Just an update on your thoughts on competing with custom silicon with A6 in AI space.
AMD_2025Q1_212.summary: The quote asks for an update on AMD's thoughts regarding competition with custom silicon in the AI space.

AMD_2025Q2_214.speaker: Jean X. Hu
AMD_2025Q2_214.original_quote: Operating expenses were approximately $2.4 billion, an increase of 32% year-over-year as we continue to invest aggressively in go-to-market activities for revenue growth and in R&D to capitalize on significant future AI expansion opportunities.
AMD_2025Q2_214.summary: AMD is investing aggressively in R&D to capitalize on significant future AI expansion opportunities.

AMD_2025Q2_215.speaker: Lisa T. Su
AMD_2025Q2_215.original_quote: We also experienced significant adoption of Ryzen AI during the first half, reflected in our sell-through numbers.
AMD_2025Q2_215.summary: AMD experienced significant adoption of Ryzen AI during the first half, which is reflected in their sell-through numbers.

AMD_2025Q2_213.speaker: Lisa T. Su
AMD_2025Q2_213.original_quote: Excluding the $800 million inventory write-down related to data center AI export controls, gross margin was 54%, marking our sixth consecutive quarter of year-over-year margin expansion led by a richer product mix.
AMD_2025Q2_213.summary: AMD reported a gross margin of 54%, which reflects their sixth consecutive quarter of year-over-year margin expansion, influenced by a richer product mix, despite an $800 million inventory write-down due to data center AI export controls.

AMD_2025Q1_211.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q1_211.original_quote: But what I will say is on the AI diffusion side we're very actively working with the government as they're thinking through these rules and it's a very fine balance that we have to have.
AMD_2025Q1_211.summary: AMD is actively working with the government as it considers regulations related to AI diffusion, emphasizing the need for a careful balance in this process.

AMD_2025Q2_217.speaker: Lisa T. Su
AMD_2025Q2_217.original_quote: So we're bullish on MI355 and where the AI opportunity is for us.
AMD_2025Q2_217.summary: AMD is optimistic about the MI355 and the AI opportunities it presents for the company.

AMD_2025Q2_218.speaker: Lisa T. Su
AMD_2025Q2_218.original_quote: I think we're seeing a lot of positive signs in our AI customer adoption, I think the strength of the MI350 series, the very positive feedback that we're getting on MI400 from customers, the work that we're doing in terms of ensuring that we are fully ready for large-scale deployments of not just in
AMD_2025Q2_218.summary: AMD is observing positive signs in AI customer adoption and receiving favorable feedback on their MI350 and MI400 series products, indicating readiness for large-scale deployments.

AMD_2025Q2_216.speaker: Lisa T. Su
AMD_2025Q2_216.original_quote: Yes, we are very excited about the AI opportunities presented by MI355 and the MI400 series as we move into the latter half of this year and into 2026.
AMD_2025Q2_216.summary: AMD is excited about the AI opportunities presented by the MI355 and MI400 series as they move into the latter half of 2025 and into 2026.

AMD_2025Q2_221.speaker: Jean X. Hu
AMD_2025Q2_221.original_quote: So if we close the ZT sale and we'll get more cash, overall, our capital allocation principle continues to be the first phase, investing, especially with the tremendous AI opportunities ahead of us.
AMD_2025Q2_221.summary: AMD is focusing on investing in capital allocation, particularly in light of the significant AI opportunities that are anticipated.

AMD_2025Q2_219.speaker: Lisa T. Su
AMD_2025Q2_219.original_quote: We're seeing stronger forecasts for server CPUs as the demand for AI content necessitates the use of traditional CPUs.
AMD_2025Q2_219.summary: AMD is observing stronger forecasts for server CPUs due to the demand for AI content, which requires traditional CPUs.

AMD_2025Q3_222.speaker: Matthew Ramsay
AMD_2025Q3_222.original_quote: Lisa Su will present at the UBS Global Technology and AI Conference on Wednesday, December 3.
AMD_2025Q3_222.summary: AMD will have Lisa Su present at the UBS Global Technology and AI Conference on December 3.

AMD_2025Q2_220.speaker: Lisa T. Su
AMD_2025Q2_220.original_quote: However, we expect hyperscalers and neoclouds, especially those collaborating with large AI companies, to be key components of the initial ramp-up.
AMD_2025Q2_220.summary: AMD expects hyperscalers and neoclouds, particularly those working with large AI companies, to play a crucial role in the initial ramp-up of their operations.

AMD_2025Q3_224.speaker: Jean Hu
AMD_2025Q3_224.original_quote: Operating expenses were approximately $2.8 billion, an increase of 42% year-over-year as we continue to invest aggressively in R&D to capitalize on significant AI opportunities and go-to-market activities for revenue growth.
AMD_2025Q3_224.summary: AMD is investing aggressively in R&D to capitalize on significant AI opportunities and enhance go-to-market activities for revenue growth.

AMD_2025Q3_227.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_227.original_quote: We're very excited about our relationship with OpenAI, as it's a significant partnership.
AMD_2025Q3_227.summary: AMD is very excited about its significant partnership with OpenAI.

AMD_2025Q3_223.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_223.original_quote: We expect this partnership will significantly accelerate our data center AI business with the potential to generate well over $100 billion in revenue over the next few years.
AMD_2025Q3_223.summary: AMD expects that this partnership will significantly accelerate their data center AI business, with the potential to generate over $100 billion in revenue in the coming years.

AMD_2025Q3_226.speaker: Vivek Arya
AMD_2025Q3_226.original_quote: And for my follow-up, there is some industry debate, Lisa, about OpenAI's ability to kind of simultaneously engage with all 3 merchants and the ASIC suppliers, just given the constraints around power and CapEx and their existing kind of CSP partners and so forth.
AMD_2025Q3_226.summary: The quote mentions an industry debate regarding OpenAI's capability to engage with multiple merchants and ASIC suppliers, considering the constraints related to power and capital expenditures with their current cloud service provider partners.

AMD_2025Q3_229.speaker: Joshua Buchalter
AMD_2025Q3_229.original_quote: So you and your largest competitor in that space have talked about near-term strength, supporting AI workloads on general purpose servers from agentic.
AMD_2025Q3_229.summary: AMD and its largest competitor have discussed near-term strength in supporting AI workloads on general-purpose servers.

AMD_2025Q3_225.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_225.original_quote: I think we saw strong outperformance in both the server as well as the data center AI business.
AMD_2025Q3_225.summary: AMD is experiencing strong outperformance in its server and data center AI business.

AMD_2025Q3_228.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_228.original_quote: I think the interest in MI450 and Helios has just expanded over the last number of weeks, certainly with some of the announcements that we've made with OpenAI and OCI as well as the OCP show with Meta.
AMD_2025Q3_228.summary: AMD is experiencing increased interest in its MI450 and Helios products, particularly following announcements related to OpenAI and OCI, as well as participation in the OCP show with Meta.

AMD_2025Q3_233.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_233.original_quote: Stacy, I think our commentary was data center grew nicely year-over-year in both of the areas, both for servers as well as data center AI.
AMD_2025Q3_233.summary: AMD reports that their data center segment has grown year-over-year, specifically highlighting growth in both server sales and data center AI.

AMD_2025Q3_231.speaker: C.J. Muse
AMD_2025Q3_231.original_quote: And I guess maybe, Lisa, to kind of probe kind of your growth expectations through '26 and beyond, and you talked about tens of billions of dollars in '27, can you kind of speak at a high level how you're thinking about OpenAI and other large customers and how we should be thinking about the breadth
AMD_2025Q3_231.summary: The company is considering the impact of OpenAI and other large customers on its growth expectations, particularly looking ahead to 2027 and beyond, with a focus on potential revenue in the tens of billions of dollars.

AMD_2025Q3_230.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_230.original_quote: This leads me to believe that the demand environment is favorable because AI is driving a significant need for general-purpose computing.
AMD_2025Q3_230.summary: AMD believes that the demand environment is favorable due to AI driving a significant need for general-purpose computing.

AMD_2025Q3_234.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_234.original_quote: Data center will increase sequentially by a strong double-digit percentage, and both server and data center AI will also see growth.
AMD_2025Q3_234.summary: AMD expects a strong double-digit percentage increase in data center revenue, with growth anticipated in both server and data center AI segments.

AMD_2025Q3_232.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_232.original_quote: The OpenAI relationship is extremely important to us, and it's great to be able to talk at the multi-gigawatt scale because I think that really is what we believe we can deliver to the marketplace.
AMD_2025Q3_232.summary: AMD emphasizes the importance of its relationship with OpenAI and expresses confidence in delivering solutions at a multi-gigawatt scale to the marketplace.

AMD_2025Q3_236.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_236.original_quote: Firstly, the OpenAI deal has been in development for a while, and we're pleased to discuss it in detail, including the scale of the deployments and engagement, which are both multiyear and multi-gigawatt.
AMD_2025Q3_236.summary: AMD is discussing the OpenAI deal that has been in development for some time, highlighting the scale of the deployments and engagement as being multiyear and multi-gigawatt.

AMD_2025Q3_235.speaker: Timothy Arcuri
AMD_2025Q3_235.original_quote: Lisa, I know it's only been a month since you announced this idea with OpenAI, but can you give us maybe some anecdotes of how this has influenced your position in the market with other customers?
AMD_2025Q3_235.summary: AMD has recently announced an idea in collaboration with OpenAI, and the analyst is asking for anecdotes on how this collaboration has impacted AMD's market position with customers.

AMD_2025Q3_241.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_241.original_quote: Our collaboration with OpenAI is particularly focused on working together on hardware, software, systems, and the future roadmap.
AMD_2025Q3_241.summary: AMD is collaborating with OpenAI to work on hardware, software, systems, and future roadmaps.

AMD_2025Q3_237.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_237.original_quote: Some of this can be attributed to server refresh cycles, but from discussions with our customers, it appears that the rise in AI workloads is leading to an increased need for traditional compute, necessitating more build-out.
AMD_2025Q3_237.summary: AMD is experiencing an increased need for traditional compute due to the rise in AI workloads, which is leading to more build-out in their infrastructure.

AMD_2025Q3_239.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_239.original_quote: But suffice it to say, from everything that we see, we see the AI compute TAM just going up.
AMD_2025Q3_239.summary: AMD sees the total addressable market (TAM) for AI compute increasing based on their observations.

AMD_2025Q3_238.speaker: Aaron Rakers
AMD_2025Q3_238.original_quote: As a quick follow-up, I'm curious and not to steal maybe the discussion from next week, but Lisa, you've been very consistent, like $500 billion of total AI silicon TAM opportunity and obviously progressing above that.
AMD_2025Q3_238.summary: The analyst mentions a total AI silicon total addressable market (TAM) opportunity of $500 billion, indicating AMD's progress in this area.

AMD_2025Q3_240.speaker: Antoine Chkaiban
AMD_2025Q3_240.original_quote: So I'd like to ask about whether the developing relationship with OpenAI could be a tailwind to the development of your software stack.
AMD_2025Q3_240.summary: AMD is exploring a developing relationship with OpenAI that could positively impact the development of its software stack.

AMD_2025Q3_242.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_242.original_quote: Additionally, there is another trend emerging, indicating a growing demand for more AI computing resources.
AMD_2025Q3_242.summary: AMD is observing a trend of increasing demand for AI computing resources.

AMD_2025Q3_243.speaker: Ross Seymore
AMD_2025Q3_243.original_quote: Lisa, this might take longer than the amount of time we have left before the top of the hour, but there's been so many of these multi-gigawatt announcements from OpenAI.
AMD_2025Q3_243.summary: The quote mentions multiple announcements from OpenAI regarding multi-gigawatt projects, implying a significant focus on energy requirements for AI operations.

AMD_2025Q3_245.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_245.original_quote: I would say it was a unique agreement considering the current time in AI.
AMD_2025Q3_245.summary: AMD is highlighting a unique agreement related to the current state of AI.

AES_2025Q1_249.speaker: Andrés Gluski
AES_2025Q1_249.original_quote: Ultimately, we aim for two primary objectives: energy dominance and leadership in the AI race.
AES_2025Q1_249.summary: The company aims for energy dominance and leadership in the AI race.

AMD_2025Q3_244.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_244.original_quote: Well, look, what I see is actually this environment where the world needs more AI compute.
AMD_2025Q3_244.summary: AMD sees a growing demand for AI compute resources in the current environment.

AES_2024Q4_247.speaker: Andres Gluski
AES_2024Q4_247.original_quote: Without timely access to power, there can be no AI revolution.
AES_2024Q4_247.summary: AES emphasizes the importance of timely access to power as a critical factor for enabling the AI revolution.

AES_2024Q2_246.speaker: Andres Gluski
AES_2024Q2_246.original_quote: Today, I will discuss our results, the significant advancements we've made with large technology customers, and the work we are doing to incorporate generative AI in our portfolio to develop new competitive advantages.
AES_2024Q2_246.summary: The company is incorporating generative AI into its portfolio to develop new competitive advantages.

AES_2025Q2_251.speaker: Andres Ricardo Gluski Weilert
AES_2025Q2_251.original_quote: One is the need to power data centers, what can be provided in the time frame needed to sort of win this competition for AI dominance.
AES_2025Q2_251.summary: AES is focusing on the need to provide power for data centers to compete in the AI dominance race.

AES_2024Q4_248.speaker: Andres Gluski
AES_2024Q4_248.original_quote: There is an unprecedented need for incremental energy to power the AI revolution in the United States.
AES_2024Q4_248.summary: AES acknowledges the unprecedented need for additional energy to support the AI revolution in the United States.

ABNB_2023Q2_257.speaker: David Stephenson
ABNB_2023Q2_257.original_quote: Presently, we leverage AI in our product offering; we utilize it for our party prevention technology and various matching technologies.
ABNB_2023Q2_257.summary: ABNB is leveraging AI in its product offering for party prevention technology and various matching technologies.

ABNB_2023Q2_255.speaker: Brian Chesky
ABNB_2023Q2_255.original_quote: Finally, I believe AI represents a once-in-a-generation platform shift, potentially even larger than the transition to mobile, and that we will be at the forefront of innovation in this area.
ABNB_2023Q2_255.summary: The company believes AI represents a significant platform shift, potentially larger than the transition to mobile, and asserts that it will be at the forefront of innovation in AI.

AFL_2025Q2_252.speaker: Masatoshi Koide
AFL_2025Q2_252.original_quote: We provide diverse digital services to customers, associates, and employees, ensuring the incorporation of new generative AI.
AFL_2025Q2_252.summary: AFL is incorporating new generative AI into its diverse digital services for customers, associates, and employees.

AES_2025Q2_250.speaker: Andres Ricardo Gluski Weilert
AES_2025Q2_250.original_quote: As part of our construction efforts, we utilized our AI robotic solar installation technology, Maximo, which makes construction significantly faster, less labor intensive and more cost effective.
AES_2025Q2_250.summary: The company is utilizing its AI robotic solar installation technology, Maximo, to make construction faster, less labor intensive, and more cost effective.

ABNB_2023Q2_258.speaker: Brian Chesky
ABNB_2023Q2_258.original_quote: With AI, we can enhance reliability and improve our service efficiency.
ABNB_2023Q2_258.summary: ABNB is using AI to enhance reliability and improve service efficiency.

A_2024Q3_253.speaker: Padraig McDonnell
A_2024Q3_253.original_quote: At the end of the quarter, we also announced the acquisition of California-based Sigsense, a start-up that uses artificial intelligence and power monitoring to help customers optimize their lab operations.
A_2024Q3_253.summary: The company announced the acquisition of Sigsense, a start-up that utilizes artificial intelligence and power monitoring to assist customers in optimizing their lab operations.

ABNB_2023Q2_256.speaker: Mark Mahaney
ABNB_2023Q2_256.original_quote: I wanted to ask Dave about the financial impact of AI and Gen AI.
ABNB_2023Q2_256.summary: The analyst is inquiring about the financial impact of AI and generative AI on the company.

ABNB_2023Q3_259.speaker: Brian Chesky
ABNB_2023Q3_259.original_quote: First, I think that we are thinking about generative AI as an opportunity to reimagine much of our product category and product catalog.
ABNB_2023Q3_259.summary: The company is considering generative AI as a way to reimagine its product category and product catalog.

ABNB_2023Q3_260.speaker: Brian Chesky
ABNB_2023Q3_260.original_quote: We're looking to leverage emerging technologies like generative AI, potentially transforming the Airbnb app into an ultimate travel agent.
ABNB_2023Q3_260.summary: Airbnb is looking to leverage generative AI to potentially transform its app into an ultimate travel agent.

ABNB_2023Q3_261.speaker: Lloyd Walmsley
ABNB_2023Q3_261.original_quote: My question, you guys have been talking a lot about innovating on the search experience, like working on GenAI, the community side, things like co-hosting.
ABNB_2023Q3_261.summary: The company is working on innovating the search experience by utilizing Generative AI and focusing on community features such as co-hosting.

ABNB_2023Q3_262.speaker: Brian Chesky
ABNB_2023Q3_262.original_quote: I generally think for sure, as Airbnb becomes a little more of a so-called AI travel agent, which is what I think all travel apps will trend towards to some extent.
ABNB_2023Q3_262.summary: Airbnb is evolving into an AI travel agent, a trend expected to be seen across all travel apps.

A_2025Q1_254.speaker: Padraig McDonnell
A_2025Q1_254.original_quote: This recognizes Agilent for its breakthroughs in scaling AI, 3D printing, robotics, big-data analytics, and the industrial internet of things.
A_2025Q1_254.summary: Agilent is recognized for its breakthroughs in scaling AI along with other technologies such as 3D printing and big-data analytics.

ABNB_2023Q4_264.speaker: Ron Josey
ABNB_2023Q4_264.original_quote: But then you also talked about being a leader in personalized AI.
ABNB_2023Q4_264.summary: The company is positioning itself as a leader in personalized AI.

ABNB_2023Q4_265.speaker: David Stephenson
ABNB_2023Q4_265.original_quote: So let me start with AI.
ABNB_2023Q4_265.summary: The executive begins by mentioning AI, indicating it will be a topic of discussion.

ABNB_2023Q4_263.speaker: Brian Chesky
ABNB_2023Q4_263.original_quote: Third, there is a new platform shift with AI, and it will allow us to do things we never could have imagined.
ABNB_2023Q4_263.summary: The company is acknowledging a new platform shift with AI that will enable them to accomplish previously unimaginable tasks.

ABNB_2024Q4_271.speaker: Brian Chesky
ABNB_2024Q4_271.original_quote: Here's what I think about AI.
ABNB_2024Q4_271.summary: The executive shares their thoughts on AI without providing specific details or context.

ABNB_2024Q1_267.speaker: Brian Chesky
ABNB_2024Q1_267.original_quote: In terms of deploying AI, we've focused on reducing friction and enhancing user experience.
ABNB_2024Q1_267.summary: The company is deploying AI to reduce friction and enhance user experience.

ABNB_2024Q4_270.speaker: Richard Clarke
ABNB_2024Q4_270.original_quote: I just want to ask about the launch we've seen of AI.
ABNB_2024Q4_270.summary: The company is launching AI initiatives.

ABNB_2024Q4_273.speaker: Brian Chesky
ABNB_2024Q4_273.original_quote: Most of the engineers are using AI tools.
ABNB_2024Q4_273.summary: The company states that most of its engineers are using AI tools.

ABNB_2024Q2_269.speaker: Brian Chesky
ABNB_2024Q2_269.original_quote: So Brian, Gen AI ChatGPT launched late November 2022.
ABNB_2024Q2_269.summary: The company mentions the launch of Gen AI ChatGPT in late November 2022.

ABNB_2024Q4_272.speaker: Eric Sheridan
ABNB_2024Q4_272.original_quote: With respect to the AI, I appreciate your answer with respect to outward-looking and how it might change the landscape.
ABNB_2024Q4_272.summary: The analyst acknowledges the company's perspective on AI and its potential impact on the industry landscape.

ABNB_2025Q1_274.speaker: Brian Chesky
ABNB_2025Q1_274.original_quote: We're focused on creating a superior user experience, and AI will play a significant role.
ABNB_2025Q1_274.summary: The company is focused on creating a superior user experience, with AI playing a significant role in that effort.

ABNB_2024Q2_268.speaker: Brian Nowak
ABNB_2024Q2_268.original_quote: And then one for Brian and sort of Gen AI and philosophical strategy.
ABNB_2024Q2_268.summary: The quote mentions a discussion about generative AI and its philosophical strategy, indicating that the company is engaging in conversations around these topics.

ABNB_2024Q1_266.speaker: Eric Sheridan
ABNB_2024Q1_266.original_quote: In that last bucket, how should we think about the role of AI in reducing friction over time?
ABNB_2024Q1_266.summary: The quote asks about the role of AI in reducing friction over time, indicating a consideration of AI's impact on operations.

ABNB_2025Q2_276.speaker: Brian Chesky
ABNB_2025Q2_276.original_quote: Regarding the Trips tab and itinerary development, this is a chance to discuss our long-term product vision, which is closely tied to our approach to artificial intelligence.
ABNB_2025Q2_276.summary: The company is discussing its long-term product vision, which is closely tied to its approach to artificial intelligence in the development of the Trips tab and itinerary features.

ABNB_2025Q2_275.speaker: Brian Chesky
ABNB_2025Q2_275.original_quote: We also expanded our new AI customer service agent in the U.S., reducing the percentage of hosting guests who need to contact a human agent by 15%.
ABNB_2025Q2_275.summary: ABNB expanded its new AI customer service agent in the U.S., which has reduced the percentage of hosting guests needing to contact a human agent by 15%.

ABNB_2025Q2_279.speaker: Brian Chesky
ABNB_2025Q2_279.original_quote: However, we will be integrating more AI into the app next year, which we can confirm.
ABNB_2025Q2_279.summary: The company is integrating more AI into the app next year.

ABNB_2025Q2_278.speaker: Kevin Campbell Kopelman
ABNB_2025Q2_278.original_quote: But your first thinking on the 1 to 2 major product launches for 2026, key focus areas, is the AI travel search you just mentioned one of those major product launches?
ABNB_2025Q2_278.summary: The company is planning to launch an AI travel search feature as one of its major product launches for 2026.

ABNB_2025Q2_277.speaker: Kevin Campbell Kopelman
ABNB_2025Q2_277.original_quote: I wanted to ask if you could share your initial thoughts on the major product launches you're considering for 2026, particularly whether the AI travel search you mentioned is one of those.
ABNB_2025Q2_277.summary: The company is considering an AI travel search as part of its major product launches for 2026.

ABNB_2025Q2_280.speaker: Elinor B. Mertz
ABNB_2025Q2_280.original_quote: Obviously, that is increasingly aided by AI as well.
ABNB_2025Q2_280.summary: The company is increasingly aided by AI in its operations.

ABNB_2025Q3_282.speaker: Brian Chesky
ABNB_2025Q3_282.original_quote: We are fostering this growth through four main strategies: enhancing our service, expanding Airbnb globally, broadening our offerings, and integrating AI throughout our app.
ABNB_2025Q3_282.summary: The company is integrating AI throughout its app as part of its growth strategies.

ABNB_2025Q3_283.speaker: Kevin Kopelman
ABNB_2025Q3_283.original_quote: Should we expect that the focus for next year are the initiatives you've already been discussing today, such as hotels, AI integration, and the continuing of experiences and services?
ABNB_2025Q3_283.summary: The company is focusing on AI integration as part of its initiatives for the next year.

ABNB_2025Q3_286.speaker: Eli Mertz
ABNB_2025Q3_286.original_quote: Therefore, you should expect us to balance investments across experiences, services, hotels, and AI while continuing to deliver strong performance from our core business.
ABNB_2025Q3_286.summary: The company is balancing investments across experiences, services, hotels, and AI while maintaining strong performance in its core business.

ABNB_2025Q3_288.speaker: Kenneth Gawrelski
ABNB_2025Q3_288.original_quote: And then the second one, maybe stepping back a little bit more on the AI search, et cetera.
ABNB_2025Q3_288.summary: The quote mentions AI search in a general context without providing specific details about its implementation or impact.

ABNB_2025Q3_289.speaker: Brian Chesky
ABNB_2025Q3_289.original_quote: As for third-party apps and our AI-powered search, I firmly believe that our own search experience remains unique and valuable while remaining open to partnerships.
ABNB_2025Q3_289.summary: ABNB is utilizing AI-powered search in their platform while also being open to partnerships with third-party apps.

ABNB_2025Q3_285.speaker: Brian Chesky
ABNB_2025Q3_285.original_quote: Let’s start with the second question, and then I'll elaborate on AI.
ABNB_2025Q3_285.summary: The company is beginning to elaborate on AI in response to a question.

ABNB_2025Q2_281.speaker: Kenneth James Gawrelski
ABNB_2025Q2_281.original_quote: First, Brian, regarding AI, do you foresee a decision needing to be made about whether to allow agent interactions and who will control that relationship, or to maintain a more closed platform?
ABNB_2025Q2_281.summary: The analyst is asking if ABNB will need to decide on allowing agent interactions with AI and who will manage that relationship, or if they will keep a more closed platform.

AKAM_2024Q3_292.speaker: Rishi Jaluria
AKAM_2024Q3_292.original_quote: Maybe, Tom, in your prepared remarks, you talked a little bit about some of the traction that you're having on the AI side, including with AI companies.
AKAM_2024Q3_292.summary: The company is experiencing traction on the AI side, particularly with AI companies.

ABNB_2025Q3_290.speaker: Brian Chesky
ABNB_2025Q3_290.original_quote: As for advertising, the travel search paradigm is changing due to AI advancements.
ABNB_2025Q3_290.summary: The company is acknowledging that advancements in AI are changing the travel search paradigm in advertising.

ABNB_2025Q3_287.speaker: Douglas Anmuth
ABNB_2025Q3_287.original_quote: Brian, Airbnb was notably absent from ChatGPT's app integration launch when other major travel players were there.
ABNB_2025Q3_287.summary: Airbnb was not part of the app integration launch for ChatGPT, unlike other major travel companies.

AKAM_2024Q3_291.speaker: Tom Leighton
AKAM_2024Q3_291.original_quote: We're already leveraging generative AI to enhance the security and ease of use of our Guardicore and WAF solutions.
AKAM_2024Q3_291.summary: Akamai is leveraging generative AI to improve the security and user-friendliness of its Guardicore and WAF solutions.

ABNB_2025Q3_284.speaker: Ronald Josey
ABNB_2025Q3_284.original_quote: I think in prepared remarks, you talked about testing the new AI-powered search coming online and rolling out next year.
ABNB_2025Q3_284.summary: ABNB is testing a new AI-powered search feature that is set to roll out next year.

AKAM_2024Q3_293.speaker: Tom Leighton
AKAM_2024Q3_293.original_quote: GenAI is already in the hands and being widely used by nefarious actors, and that's one reason why we're seeing a lot more attacks and penetrations.
AKAM_2024Q3_293.summary: Akamai highlights that GenAI is being widely used by malicious actors, contributing to an increase in attacks and security breaches.

AKAM_2024Q3_294.speaker: Frank Louthan
AKAM_2024Q3_294.original_quote: And is there any aspect of their new networks that they're building to support their AI partners that they're having conversations with you about, about implementing your capabilities and layering them on top of that network to help maybe deliver some of that AI traffic?
AKAM_2024Q3_294.summary: Akamai is discussing the implementation of their capabilities on new networks being built to support AI partners, specifically in relation to delivering AI traffic.

AKAM_2024Q4_296.speaker: Tom Leighton
AKAM_2024Q4_296.original_quote: We added GPUs for a variety of AI and media use cases.
AKAM_2024Q4_296.summary: The company added GPUs to support various AI and media use cases.

AKAM_2024Q4_299.speaker: Tom Leighton
AKAM_2024Q4_299.original_quote: Yes, I think there's a lot of AI-powered at image normalization so that the various images have the same consistent size, quality image classification even for things like detecting disease in crops.
AKAM_2024Q4_299.summary: Akamai is utilizing AI for image normalization to ensure consistent size and quality in image classification, which includes applications like disease detection in crops.

AKAM_2024Q4_297.speaker: Madeline Brooks
AKAM_2024Q4_297.original_quote: Specifically, does it relate to any of the newer products you've developed in AI or similar areas?
AKAM_2024Q4_297.summary: The analyst is inquiring whether the company's newer products are related to AI or similar areas.

AKAM_2024Q3_295.speaker: Tom Leighton
AKAM_2024Q3_295.original_quote: There's a couple of database partners, observability widely being sold, live encoding, transcoding, video packaging, WebRTC for interactive video, digital asset management, optimization of video, game orchestration, fleet management, DRM, Kubernetes, connectivity and auto scaling, server side ad ins
AKAM_2024Q3_295.summary: The company is selling a range of services including live encoding, transcoding, video packaging, and observability, which are integrated with AI technologies for optimization and management.

AKAM_2024Q4_298.speaker: William Power
AKAM_2024Q4_298.original_quote: And I just I wonder if you maybe update on this, just as along the lines of the tone of conversations you're having, what kind of the pipeline looks like, just kind of the activity level you're seeing in terms of taking advantage of particularly some of these generative AI applications and inference
AKAM_2024Q4_298.summary: The analyst is inquiring about updates on the company's pipeline and activity levels related to generative AI applications and inference.

AKAM_2024Q4_300.speaker: Tom Leighton
AKAM_2024Q4_300.original_quote: It's important to highlight that this currently represents a $100 billion market, not factoring in AI or the significant new deal we've secured.
AKAM_2024Q4_300.summary: The company highlights that the current market size is $100 billion, excluding AI and a significant new deal they have secured.

AKAM_2024Q4_301.speaker: Mark Murphy
AKAM_2024Q4_301.original_quote: Maybe some of these AI applications are going to become more economically viable.
AKAM_2024Q4_301.summary: The company suggests that certain AI applications may become more economically viable in the future.

AKAM_2025Q1_304.speaker: Tom Leighton
AKAM_2025Q1_304.original_quote: There's a lot of attacks now that have been published against AI apps of all kinds, including agentic AI.
AKAM_2025Q1_304.summary: The company is acknowledging the increase in attacks targeting AI applications, including those involving agentic AI.

AKAM_2025Q1_302.speaker: Tom Leighton
AKAM_2025Q1_302.original_quote: For example, in one proof of concept, a company's artificial intelligence application achieved 30% faster response times using our new Butte platform than they had with a hyperscaler.
AKAM_2025Q1_302.summary: A company's artificial intelligence application achieved 30% faster response times using Akamai's new Butte platform compared to a hyperscaler.

AKAM_2025Q1_305.speaker: Tom Leighton
AKAM_2025Q1_305.original_quote: Ease of use has come up in several accounts, particularly with our new AI-enabled interface that can make the integration be a lot faster and simpler.
AKAM_2025Q1_305.summary: Akamai is implementing a new AI-enabled interface that enhances ease of use and simplifies integration for customers.

AKAM_2025Q1_307.speaker: Tom Leighton
AKAM_2025Q1_307.original_quote: We have the market-leading solutions, and now we are adding in firewall for AI — just starting but a lot of customer interest there.
AKAM_2025Q1_307.summary: Akamai is adding firewall solutions specifically for AI and has noted significant customer interest in this development.

AKAM_2025Q1_306.speaker: Tom Leighton
AKAM_2025Q1_306.original_quote: We're shifting for the force towards hunting now that we have products that a lot of new to Akamai customers need, for example, API security, segmentation, cloud computing, and they're going to need firewall for AI as well.
AKAM_2025Q1_306.summary: Akamai is shifting its focus towards new products that include firewall solutions specifically for AI, which are needed by many new customers.

AKAM_2025Q2_309.speaker: F. Thomson Leighton
AKAM_2025Q2_309.original_quote: And of course, if you think about the impact of Gen AI, one of the sort of bad impacts in general is that it really aids the attackers.
AKAM_2025Q2_309.summary: The company acknowledges that generative AI has a negative impact by aiding attackers in cyber threats.

AKAM_2025Q1_303.speaker: Jonathan Ho
AKAM_2025Q1_303.original_quote: Can you provide a little bit more detail on the role you can play with agentic AI with your AI firewall?
AKAM_2025Q1_303.summary: The analyst is asking for more details about the role of agentic AI in relation to the company's AI firewall.

AKAM_2025Q2_310.speaker: Jonathan Frank Ho
AKAM_2025Q2_310.original_quote: With your AI commentary, what kind of opportunity are you seeing there?
AKAM_2025Q2_310.summary: The analyst is inquiring about the opportunities that AKAM sees in relation to AI.

AKAM_2025Q2_308.speaker: F. Thomson Leighton
AKAM_2025Q2_308.original_quote: Examples of the many contracts we signed in Q2 that included a large commitment for our cloud infrastructure services include a three-year $16 million renewal and expansion agreement with one of the largest companies at the forefront of the AI revolution, a two-year $28 million agreement with one of
AKAM_2025Q2_308.summary: Akamai signed a three-year $16 million renewal and expansion agreement with a major company involved in the AI revolution, along with a two-year $28 million agreement with another entity.

AKAM_2025Q2_311.speaker: F. Thomson Leighton
AKAM_2025Q2_311.original_quote: Yes, we are developing a strong capability for AI firewall, although it is still in its early stages.
AKAM_2025Q2_311.summary: The company is developing a strong capability for an AI firewall, but it is still in its early stages.

AKAM_2025Q3_313.speaker: Ed McGowan
AKAM_2025Q3_313.original_quote: We are very excited about the potential of the Akamai Inference Cloud as we extend AI to the edge.
AKAM_2025Q3_313.summary: Akamai is extending AI to the edge through the Akamai Inference Cloud, which they are very excited about.

AKAM_2025Q3_316.speaker: Rishi Jaluria
AKAM_2025Q3_316.original_quote: However, we also know that all hyperscalers are facing capacity constraints and are trying to find resources as they look to advance AI in both training and inferencing.
AKAM_2025Q3_316.summary: Akamai acknowledges that hyperscalers are experiencing capacity constraints while seeking resources to advance AI in training and inferencing.

AKAM_2025Q3_319.speaker: Tom Leighton
AKAM_2025Q3_319.original_quote: And so you're going to need API security, you're going to need like an AI firewall.
AKAM_2025Q3_319.summary: The company is indicating the necessity for an AI firewall as part of API security measures.

AKAM_2025Q3_312.speaker: Tom Leighton
AKAM_2025Q3_312.original_quote: It offers an objective third-party perspective of how Akamai has evolved our strategy and our key differentiators in security and distributed cloud computing for AI inferencing at the edge.
AKAM_2025Q3_312.summary: Akamai is evolving its strategy and key differentiators in security and distributed cloud computing specifically for AI inferencing at the edge.
