CSCO_2025Q1_1605.speaker: Scott Herren
CSCO_2025Q1_1605.original_quote: During Q1, we closed two software acquisitions: DeepFactor, to accelerate innovation in the Cisco Security Cloud and augment our Secure Access offerings, and Robust Intelligence, which brings enhanced protection for AI models throughout their life cycle from development to production.
CSCO_2025Q1_1605.summary: During Q1, Cisco closed two software acquisitions, DeepFactor to enhance the Cisco Security Cloud and Robust Intelligence to provide better protection for AI models throughout their life cycle.

CTAS_2025Q4_1602.original_quote: And now machine learning and artificial intelligence is certainly in the early innings for us.

CSCO_2025Q1_1606.speaker: Chuck Robbins
CSCO_2025Q1_1606.original_quote: Regarding our involvement in various areas like routing, switching, and optical, we have orders exceeding $300 million in Q1 for AI and webscale solutions, positioning us well to exceed our $1 billion target for the year.

CI_2025Q4_1599.summary: The company expanded its suite of AI-powered digital tools to enhance and personalize customer experiences.

CSCO_2025Q1_1609.speaker: Chuck Robbins
CSCO_2025Q1_1609.original_quote: Regarding AI orders, I believe we are on track to exceed the $1 billion target.
CSCO_2025Q1_1609.summary: The company is on track to exceed its $1 billion target for AI orders.

CIEN_2025Q3_1587.speaker: Gary Smith
CIEN_2025Q3_1587.original_quote: And I also think the other dynamic around this shift of workloads, as you start getting these work AI workloads closer to the edge, you're really talking service providers.

CIEN_2025Q3_1586.speaker: Gary Smith
CIEN_2025Q3_1586.original_quote: And I think if you think about the growth opportunities that we've got across the board on our AI workloads, we really want to prioritize those.
CIEN_2025Q3_1586.summary: The company is prioritizing growth opportunities related to their AI workloads.

CSCO_2025Q1_1612.speaker: Chuck Robbins
CSCO_2025Q1_1612.original_quote: Customers are continuing to invest in upgrades, especially as AI applications become more prevalent in enterprises.

CSCO_2023Q1_1603.speaker: Chuck Robbins
CSCO_2023Q1_1603.original_quote: Networking is becoming increasingly critical to every organization, led by digital transformation, hybrid cloud, AI and ML workloads.
CSCO_2023Q1_1603.summary: The company states that networking is becoming increasingly critical to organizations due to digital transformation, hybrid cloud, and AI and ML workloads.

CSCO_2025Q1_1608.speaker: Samik Chatterjee

CSCO_2025Q1_1608.summary: The analyst notes optimism regarding AI orders potentially exceeding the $1 billion target, inquiring about its implications for revenue realization this year.

CSCO_2025Q1_1621.speaker: Scott Herren
CSCO_2025Q1_1621.original_quote: It was more about finding efficiencies across the company and turning around and reinvesting those in the fastest growing parts of our business, namely AI and security, and you see some of the great results coming out of that.
CSCO_2025Q1_1621.summary: The company is finding efficiencies across its operations and reinvesting those efficiencies into its fastest growing areas, specifically AI and security, which is yielding positive results.

CIEN_2025Q4_1595.speaker: Gary Smith

CIEN_2025Q4_1595.summary: The company states that training at scale across AI backbones is primarily the responsibility of large hyperscalers at this stage.

CSCO_2025Q1_1611.speaker: Chuck Robbins
CSCO_2025Q1_1611.original_quote: A couple of quarters ago, we announced Hyperfabric, a fabric as a service solution designed to provide public cloud simplicity for AI workloads in enterprises, which will be available in early 2025.
CSCO_2025Q1_1611.summary: Cisco is launching Hyperfabric, a fabric as a service solution aimed at simplifying public cloud usage for AI workloads in enterprises, with availability set for early 2025.

CSCO_2025Q1_1614.speaker: Chuck Robbins
CSCO_2025Q1_1614.original_quote: So, on the first question relative to AI in the enterprise in particular, I think we're all seeing customers focus on customer experience.

CSCO_2025Q1_1615.speaker: Scott Herren
CSCO_2025Q1_1615.original_quote: I believe that our investments in AI and our networking portfolio, particularly with the recent launch of Wi-Fi 7, are yielding positive results.
CSCO_2025Q1_1615.summary: The company is investing in AI alongside its networking portfolio, and it highlights that these investments, particularly with the launch of Wi-Fi 7, are producing positive outcomes.

CSCO_2025Q1_1619.speaker: Chuck Robbins
CSCO_2025Q1_1619.original_quote: Enterprises are focusing on two main aspects: updating their infrastructure for AI and preparing for widespread deployment of AI applications.
CSCO_2025Q1_1619.summary: Enterprises are updating their infrastructure for AI and preparing for the widespread deployment of AI applications.

CSCO_2025Q1_1616.speaker: Scott Herren
CSCO_2025Q1_1616.original_quote: I'd say AI has been a bright spot for us.
CSCO_2025Q1_1616.summary: The company states that AI has been a positive aspect for them.

CSCO_2025Q1_1618.speaker: Aaron Rakers
CSCO_2025Q1_1618.original_quote: So, on this AI opportunity and as we kind of focus on the backlog converting into revenue, I'm curious of how you see the AI back-end possibly leading into front-end opportunities.
CSCO_2025Q1_1618.summary: The company is focusing on converting its AI backlog into revenue and is exploring how the AI back-end can lead to front-end opportunities.

CSCO_2025Q1_1617.speaker: Chuck Robbins
CSCO_2025Q1_1617.original_quote: I think from a security perspective and a strategic security perspective, our large enterprise customers are incredibly optimistic about what Hypershield means for them, but from an AI application deployment perspective, our customers are very excited about what Hyperfabric will mean to them.

CSCO_2025Q1_1620.speaker: Karl Ackerman
CSCO_2025Q1_1620.original_quote: But I guess, are these product orders all four top of rack switches, or is the growth in AI networking hardware primarily driven by one hyperscaler today, which now appears to be across silicon and switches?
CSCO_2025Q1_1620.summary: The quote inquires whether the growth in AI networking hardware is driven by one hyperscaler and if it pertains to top of rack switches or other silicon products.

CSCO_2025Q1_1623.speaker: Chuck Robbins
CSCO_2025Q1_1623.original_quote: I think that as we talk about this whole AI transformation that's happening, I think, again, there are three big areas that we're focused on.
CSCO_2025Q1_1623.summary: The company is focused on three big areas related to the ongoing AI transformation.

CSCO_2025Q1_1622.speaker: Chuck Robbins
CSCO_2025Q1_1622.original_quote: And I would say that it was not just one customer on the AI infrastructure front; it was pretty balanced across all of them.
CSCO_2025Q1_1622.summary: The company is experiencing balanced demand from multiple customers for its AI infrastructure offerings.

CSCO_2025Q2_1627.speaker: Chuck Robbins
CSCO_2025Q2_1627.original_quote: On your second question, we absolutely believe that a lot of this demand is being driven by customers preparing for AI.
CSCO_2025Q2_1627.summary: The company believes that much of the demand is being driven by customers preparing for AI.

CSCO_2025Q2_1628.speaker: Matthew Niknam
CSCO_2025Q2_1628.original_quote: You talk about enterprises investing a little bit more in AI.
CSCO_2025Q2_1628.summary: The quote mentions that enterprises are increasing their investments in AI.

CSCO_2025Q1_1604.speaker: Chuck Robbins
CSCO_2025Q1_1604.original_quote: In Q1, our webscale customers placed AI infrastructure orders in excess of $300 million.
CSCO_2025Q1_1604.summary: In Q1, the company received AI infrastructure orders from webscale customers totaling over $300 million.

CSCO_2025Q2_1625.speaker: Scott Herren
CSCO_2025Q2_1625.original_quote: During Q2, we closed the acquisition of Deeper Insights, to expand our Customer Experience team's technology footprint and engineering talent, accelerating innovation and momentum of Cisco's CX AI capabilities and services.
CSCO_2025Q2_1625.summary: Cisco closed the acquisition of Deeper Insights to enhance its Customer Experience team's technology and engineering talent, which will accelerate the innovation and momentum of Cisco's CX AI capabilities and services.

CSCO_2025Q2_1630.summary: The quote mentions the AI momentum observed in hyperscaler environments.

CSCO_2025Q2_1631.summary: CSCO is currently engaging with over 20 customers who are interested in pursuing proof of concept projects related to AI defense following their recent AI Summit.

CSCO_2025Q2_1624.speaker: Chuck Robbins
CSCO_2025Q2_1624.original_quote: Importantly, our AI infrastructure orders with webscalers in Q2 surpassed $350 million, bringing our year-to-date total to approximately $700 million, and we are on track to exceed $1 billion of AI infrastructure orders in fiscal year '25.
CSCO_2025Q2_1624.summary: CSCO's AI infrastructure orders with webscalers in Q2 exceeded $350 million, leading to a year-to-date total of about $700 million, and they expect to surpass $1 billion in AI infrastructure orders for fiscal year '25.

CSCO_2025Q2_1633.speaker: Chuck Robbins
CSCO_2025Q2_1633.original_quote: On the $700 million in AI orders, it's a combination of systems, silicon, optics and optical systems.
CSCO_2025Q2_1633.summary: Cisco has received $700 million in AI orders, which includes a combination of systems, silicon, optics, and optical systems.

CSCO_2025Q2_1634.speaker: Jim Fish
CSCO_2025Q2_1634.original_quote: And then secondly, to the last question, what are you guys seeing from where you're winning within the data center between the Silicon One approach versus sort of systems approach with your AI wins?
CSCO_2025Q2_1634.summary: The company is winning in the data center by leveraging its Silicon One approach in conjunction with AI solutions.

CSCO_2025Q3_1644.speaker: Chuck Robbins
CSCO_2025Q3_1644.original_quote: The AI transition is crucial, and I believe they will continue to invest until it becomes absolutely necessary to halt spending.
CSCO_2025Q3_1644.summary: The company believes that the AI transition is crucial and plans to continue investing in AI until it is absolutely necessary to stop spending.

CSCO_2025Q2_1635.speaker: Chuck Robbins
CSCO_2025Q2_1635.original_quote: On these other deals, I mean, if you look at technology like DeepSeek, we think not DeepSeek in particular, but we think as see more of this democratization of the access that is going to just facilitate a faster advancement of AI applications in the enterprise, first of all.
CSCO_2025Q2_1635.summary: Cisco believes that the democratization of access to technologies like DeepSeek will facilitate faster advancement of AI applications in the enterprise.

CSCO_2025Q2_1639.speaker: Karl Ackerman
CSCO_2025Q2_1639.original_quote: Is the greater visibility and support of your April core outlook from enterprises and even telco operators, coming from just a return to normal order patterns or lead times extending out beyond a quarter across those customers as you begin to introduce AI pods and Hybridshield and perhaps some on-pr
CSCO_2025Q2_1639.summary: The company is introducing AI pods and Hybridshield, which suggests a focus on integrating AI into their offerings for enterprises and telco operators.

CSCO_2025Q2_1637.speaker: Chuck Robbins
CSCO_2025Q2_1637.original_quote: Now we believe with the Nvidia partnership, the hyper fabric stack, the AI pods, the things that we're building, we think that as we integrate that stack together and they have these reference architectures to build that we think that, that will lead to our networking equipment being combined with N
CSCO_2025Q2_1637.summary: CSCO is integrating its networking equipment with AI pods and a hyper fabric stack in collaboration with Nvidia, utilizing reference architectures to enhance their offerings.

CSCO_2025Q2_1638.speaker: Aaron Rakers
CSCO_2025Q2_1638.original_quote: As you think about that 50% of your business on the AI orders being tied to switch and Silicon One silicon.
CSCO_2025Q2_1638.summary: Cisco reports that 50% of its business related to AI orders is connected to its switch and Silicon One silicon products.

CSCO_2025Q2_1640.speaker: Scott Herren
CSCO_2025Q2_1640.original_quote: And what we hear from telco, particularly in international, is they are in anticipation of demand on their networks driven by AI, doing the same thing that we hear enterprise is doing.
CSCO_2025Q2_1640.summary: CSCO hears from international telcos that they anticipate demand on their networks driven by AI, similar to what is being reported by enterprises.

CSCO_2025Q3_1646.speaker: Chuck Robbins
CSCO_2025Q3_1646.original_quote: The general belief and feedback that we're getting from these customers is as they get ready to roll out a genetic AI, in particular, the network is absolutely going to be key because of the real-time nature of this communication, and they all want to ensure that while they may not know exactly what
CSCO_2025Q3_1646.summary: The company is receiving feedback from customers that the network will be crucial for rolling out generative AI due to the need for real-time communication.

CSCO_2025Q3_1645.speaker: Scott Herren
CSCO_2025Q3_1645.original_quote: And Tal, just to remind you, as we continue to build out all the public cloud infrastructure for training, there is a significantly larger opportunity in enterprise AI as companies develop the capability to perform inferencing within their own data centers.
CSCO_2025Q3_1645.summary: Cisco is building out public cloud infrastructure for training and sees a larger opportunity in enterprise AI as companies develop the capability for inferencing in their own data centers.

CSCO_2025Q3_1651.speaker: Chuck Robbins
CSCO_2025Q3_1651.original_quote: On the first one, I think the short answer is that most of this AI infrastructure has not begun to flow through revenue yet.
CSCO_2025Q3_1651.summary: The company indicates that the AI infrastructure they are developing has not yet started to generate revenue.

CSCO_2025Q3_1654.speaker: Chuck Robbins
CSCO_2025Q3_1654.original_quote: The AI orders in the enterprise space have been somewhat challenging for us to identify, but we've been working on establishing a baseline.
CSCO_2025Q3_1654.summary: The company is working on establishing a baseline to identify AI orders in the enterprise space, which have been somewhat challenging to pinpoint.

CSCO_2025Q3_1655.speaker: Adrienne Colby
CSCO_2025Q3_1655.original_quote: It's been a while since you talked about your AI pipeline versus your AI orders.
CSCO_2025Q3_1655.summary: The analyst is inquiring about the company's AI pipeline in relation to its AI orders, indicating a desire for an update on these aspects.

CSCO_2025Q3_1648.speaker: Chuck Robbins
CSCO_2025Q3_1648.original_quote: Regarding AI orders, it's important to remember that these are large customers and the orders are non-linear.
CSCO_2025Q3_1648.summary: CSCO is receiving AI orders from large customers, and these orders are characterized as non-linear.

CSCO_2025Q3_1647.speaker: Amit Daryanani
CSCO_2025Q3_1647.original_quote: Starting off your AI orders at $1 billion, it came in, I think, a quarter ahead of what you had expected, and it looks like you're seeing some continued momentum as you go forward with sovereign and enterprise that you talked about.
CSCO_2025Q3_1647.summary: CSCO is experiencing AI orders starting at $1 billion, which came in a quarter earlier than expected, indicating continued momentum in sovereign and enterprise sectors.

CSCO_2025Q3_1656.speaker: Chuck Robbins
CSCO_2025Q3_1656.original_quote: Yes, we currently do not provide details on our AI pipeline.
CSCO_2025Q3_1656.summary: The company is not providing details on its AI pipeline.

CSCO_2025Q2_1632.speaker: Amit Daryanani
CSCO_2025Q2_1632.original_quote: Just a quick question on the 700 million AI orders so far this year.
CSCO_2025Q2_1632.summary: CSCO has received 700 million in AI orders so far this year.

CSCO_2025Q3_1652.speaker: Andrew Spinola
CSCO_2025Q3_1652.original_quote: I wanted to ask about the nature of the $600 million in AI orders.
CSCO_2025Q3_1652.summary: The company has received $600 million in AI orders.

CSCO_2025Q3_1649.speaker: Chuck Robbins
CSCO_2025Q3_1649.original_quote: You'll see us focusing on integrating AI and security services within the network so that our customers can implement this seamlessly, which is essential for addressing AI challenges.
CSCO_2025Q3_1649.summary: CSCO is focusing on integrating AI and security services within the network to allow customers to implement these solutions seamlessly, addressing AI challenges.

CSCO_2025Q3_1650.speaker: Jim Fish
CSCO_2025Q3_1650.original_quote: If AI really isn't substitutionary of existing non-AI networking real estate with some of these web scales and enterprise is growing at the rates you're calling out, why isn't this sort of growing faster than even the 8% on the comp here?
CSCO_2025Q3_1650.summary: The analyst questions why AI isn't growing faster than 8% if it isn't replacing existing non-AI networking solutions and if enterprise growth is as projected.

CSCO_2025Q3_1653.speaker: Karl Ackerman
CSCO_2025Q3_1653.original_quote: I was hoping you could quantify your AI orders for the enterprise at our incremental to the $1 billion of order target you have for cloud.
CSCO_2025Q3_1653.summary: The analyst is asking CSCO to quantify their AI orders for the enterprise in addition to their $1 billion order target for cloud services.

CSCO_2025Q3_1658.speaker: Chuck Robbins
CSCO_2025Q3_1658.original_quote: As we look ahead, we see a strong opportunity in AI and believe we are well positioned.
CSCO_2025Q3_1658.summary: The company sees a strong opportunity in AI and believes it is well positioned for future developments.

CSCO_2025Q3_1657.speaker: Sebastien Naji

CSCO_2025Q3_1657.summary: The analyst is questioning whether AI is the factor influencing the share shift or if other factors are at play.

CSCO_2025Q4_1661.speaker: Charles H. Robbins
CSCO_2025Q4_1661.original_quote: I want to emphasize that we are satisfied with our performance in the AI space.
CSCO_2025Q4_1661.summary: The company is satisfied with its performance in the AI space.

CSCO_2025Q4_1659.speaker: Charles H. Robbins
CSCO_2025Q4_1659.original_quote: According to our survey of IT networking leaders, 97% of businesses believe they need to upgrade their networks to successfully deploy AI.
CSCO_2025Q4_1659.summary: CSCO states that their survey indicates 97% of businesses believe network upgrades are necessary for successful AI deployment.

CSCO_2025Q4_1660.speaker: Aaron Christopher Rakers
CSCO_2025Q4_1660.original_quote: My first question is regarding your guidance, particularly in light of the AI opportunity and the impact of sovereign initiatives starting in the second half of the fiscal year.
CSCO_2025Q4_1660.summary: The analyst is inquiring about the company's guidance in relation to the AI opportunity and the influence of sovereign initiatives expected in the latter half of the fiscal year.

CSCO_2025Q4_1663.speaker: Mark Patterson
CSCO_2025Q4_1663.original_quote: And I think as I look ahead, we have significant opportunity, whether it's in AI infrastructure, in the webscale space, now in the nascent but growing enterprise AI opportunity.
CSCO_2025Q4_1663.summary: The company sees significant opportunities in AI infrastructure, particularly in the webscale space and the emerging enterprise AI market.

CSCO_2025Q2_1641.speaker: Chuck Robbins
CSCO_2025Q2_1641.original_quote: And I think the other thing that we see some of the European operators are looking at delivering AI as a service.
CSCO_2025Q2_1641.summary: The company notes that some European operators are exploring the delivery of AI as a service.

CSCO_2025Q4_1664.speaker: Simon Matthew Leopold
CSCO_2025Q4_1664.original_quote: And then as my follow-up, I'm wondering if you could talk about your expectations over the longer term for the composition of the AI business.
CSCO_2025Q4_1664.summary: The company is being asked about its expectations for the long-term composition of its AI business.

CSCO_2025Q4_1665.speaker: Charles H. Robbins
CSCO_2025Q4_1665.original_quote: Regarding your second question about the AI business composition, particularly in the back-end networks of cloud providers, I don't believe there's any indication of a significant shift based on our discussions with them.
CSCO_2025Q4_1665.summary: The company indicates that there is no significant shift in the AI business composition within the back-end networks of cloud providers based on their discussions.

CSCO_2025Q4_1666.speaker: Charles H. Robbins
CSCO_2025Q4_1666.original_quote: If we take a step back, we can identify two key factors at play: the AI revolution and the refresh opportunity.
CSCO_2025Q4_1666.summary: The company identifies the AI revolution as a key factor influencing its strategy, alongside a refresh opportunity.

CSCO_2025Q4_1673.speaker: Charles H. Robbins
CSCO_2025Q4_1673.original_quote: So I don't feel like AI is a fleeting trend.
CSCO_2025Q4_1673.summary: The executive expresses confidence that AI is not just a temporary trend.

CSCO_2025Q3_1643.speaker: Chuck Robbins
CSCO_2025Q3_1643.original_quote: In addition, we received AI infrastructure orders from web-scale customers in excess of $600 million in Q3, bringing our year-to-date total to well over $1 billion, surpassing our original fiscal year '25 AI order target a full quarter early.
CSCO_2025Q3_1643.summary: The company received AI infrastructure orders from web-scale customers exceeding $600 million in Q3, resulting in a year-to-date total of over $1 billion, which surpasses their original fiscal year '25 AI order target a quarter early.

CSCO_2025Q4_1667.summary: The company has received over $2 billion in AI orders this year.

CSCO_2025Q4_1669.summary: CSCO reports that revenue and shipments related to AI orders progressed and ramped as expected during FY '25.

CSCO_2025Q4_1678.summary: AI could contribute approximately 2 points of revenue growth to the networking business in fiscal '26, based on order intake averages.

CSCO_2025Q4_1668.speaker: Charles H. Robbins
CSCO_2025Q4_1668.original_quote: Regarding AI infrastructure, we received over $800 million in orders for the quarter, totaling more than $2 billion for the year, which is more than double our original target.
CSCO_2025Q4_1668.summary: The company received over $800 million in orders for AI infrastructure in the quarter, totaling more than $2 billion for the year, which exceeds their original target by more than double.

CSCO_2025Q4_1671.summary: The analyst is inquiring about the revenue contribution from AI that Cisco is embedding in fiscal year '26, referencing a $2 billion order from the current year.

CSCO_2025Q4_1670.speaker: Charles H. Robbins
CSCO_2025Q4_1670.original_quote: So we recognized roughly $1 billion of revenue on the AI back-end orders that we've taken from the webscale customers during fiscal year '25.
CSCO_2025Q4_1670.summary: CSCO recognized approximately $1 billion in revenue from AI back-end orders received from webscale customers during fiscal year '25.

CSCO_2025Q4_1679.original_quote: And I also wanted to just circle back on the sovereign AI opportunities about your expectations in terms of order flow and revenue recognition there.
CSCO_2025Q4_1679.summary: The company is discussing expectations regarding order flow and revenue recognition related to sovereign AI opportunities.

CSCO_2025Q4_1674.original_quote: But security, I mean, your execution in switching and the AI stuff is obviously better than expected, but the security was pretty well below the street, and it has to accelerate pretty significantly to get to your 15% to 17% growth for security plus observability long-term target.
CSCO_2025Q4_1674.summary: The quote mentions that the execution in AI-related initiatives is better than expected, but it also highlights that security performance is below expectations and needs to improve significantly to meet long-term growth targets.

CSCO_2025Q4_1680.summary: The analyst is inquiring about the long-term opportunities related to back-end AI networks.

C_2025Q4_1689.original_quote: In data, we've significantly accelerated progress over the past year, and some of that has been helped by AI as well.
C_2025Q4_1689.summary: The company has significantly accelerated progress in data over the past year, aided by AI.

CSCO_2025Q4_1662.speaker: Charles H. Robbins
CSCO_2025Q4_1662.original_quote: Previously, I mentioned that we have two categories of products: the new and refreshed ones, which include SASE, XDR, Hypershield, AI Defense, and our updated firewall portfolio, and the older products that aren't significant investment areas for us at the moment, representing the long tail of the p
CSCO_2025Q4_1662.summary: The company is offering new and refreshed products that include AI Defense as part of their portfolio, indicating a focus on integrating AI into their security solutions.

CFG_2025Q2_1692.speaker: John Woods
CFG_2025Q2_1692.original_quote: In support of these businesses, we've commenced work on a broad reimagining the bank initiative that will drive meaningful benefits by revisiting how we operate front to back and leveraging new technologies like AI to serve customers in new ways and run the bank better.
CFG_2025Q2_1692.summary: The bank has started a broad initiative to reimagine its operations by leveraging new technologies like AI to improve customer service and enhance overall bank operations.

C_2023Q1_1682.speaker: Mark Mason
C_2023Q1_1682.original_quote: We’re also modernizing our infrastructure and enhancing the security of our data and information by improving cybersecurity through the use of AI and enhancing the security of our infrastructure and devices, leading to fewer operating losses.
C_2023Q1_1682.summary: The company is modernizing its infrastructure and enhancing data security by using AI to improve cybersecurity, which is expected to lead to fewer operating losses.

CSCO_2025Q4_1681.speaker: Charles H. Robbins
CSCO_2025Q4_1681.original_quote: Artificial intelligence is undeniably a significant advantage for us, along with the momentum in webscale, the growth of the enterprise, sovereign opportunities, and Neocloud.
CSCO_2025Q4_1681.summary: Cisco acknowledges that artificial intelligence provides a significant advantage for the company, alongside other growth areas like webscale and enterprise opportunities.

C_2025Q1_1685.speaker: Jane Fraser

C_2025Q1_1685.summary: The company is integrating AI directly into its business operations to enhance the client experience.

C_2024Q4_1684.speaker: Jane Fraser
C_2024Q4_1684.original_quote: Consolidating technology, the simplification work, automation, getting different utilities put in place rather than fragmented around the firm using AI tools now, our location strategy, right?
C_2024Q4_1684.summary: The company is consolidating technology and simplifying operations by using AI tools to automate processes and integrate various utilities across the firm.

C_2025Q2_1687.summary: The company is expecting continued productivity improvements, some of which will be enabled by AI.

C_2025Q4_1688.speaker: Jane Fraser
C_2025Q4_1688.original_quote: Combined with how we're deploying AI, this bank is being truly transformed in terms of its operational capabilities, its controls, and its tech infrastructure compared to five years ago.
C_2025Q4_1688.summary: The bank is being transformed through the deployment of AI, enhancing its operational capabilities, controls, and technology infrastructure compared to five years ago.

C_2025Q1_1686.speaker: Jane Fraser
C_2025Q1_1686.original_quote: And we're still innovating and investing in supporting our businesses with new innovations in different areas, talk briefly about AI, a lot of work and services there, USBB and Andium wealth.
C_2025Q1_1686.summary: The company is innovating and investing in AI to support its businesses, specifically mentioning work and services related to AI in USBB and Andium wealth.

C_2024Q4_1683.speaker: Jane Fraser
C_2024Q4_1683.original_quote: We accelerated our use of AI, arming 30,000 developers with tools to write code and launched two AI platforms to make our 143,000 colleagues more efficient.
C_2024Q4_1683.summary: The company accelerated its use of AI by providing 30,000 developers with tools for code generation and launched two AI platforms to enhance the efficiency of its 143,000 employees.

CFG_2025Q3_1696.speaker: Chris Emerson
CFG_2025Q3_1696.original_quote: We have a team of executives from across the bank working on cultivating technology and AI-enabled ideas that will empower our colleagues to run the bank better, and we are looking at all our key customer touchpoints to simplify and improve customer experience.
CFG_2025Q3_1696.summary: CFG is cultivating technology and AI-enabled ideas to empower colleagues in running the bank more effectively, while also focusing on improving customer experience at key touchpoints.

CFG_2025Q2_1695.speaker: Brendan Coughlin
CFG_2025Q2_1695.original_quote: Everything is on the table, and we are bullish on long-term value creation from AI and Agentic AI.
CFG_2025Q2_1695.summary: The company is optimistic about long-term value creation from AI and Agentic AI, indicating that they are considering various options related to these technologies.

CFG_2025Q2_1693.original_quote: The use cases on AI are becoming a little bit more real versus hopes and dreams.
CFG_2025Q2_1693.summary: The company states that the use cases for AI are becoming more tangible and realistic, moving beyond just aspirations.

CFG_2025Q2_1694.summary: The quote states that most banks, when discussing agentic AI, focus on its application in call centers and customer relationship management (CRM).

KO_2023Q3_1704.summary: The company is making investments in traditional technology, AI, and emerging generative AIs.

KO_2024Q1_1706.summary: K-Wave includes an AI-based fan experience as part of its global collaboration with three K-pop groups.

CMS_2024Q3_1701.summary: The company is investing in grid technology that incorporates automation and machine learning to enhance the speed of restoration during weather events.

CTSH_2023Q1_1708.summary: The company is helping to enhance customer, employee, and partner experiences at Nike by utilizing hyper-automation and AI.

CFG_2025Q4_1699.speaker: Brendan Coughlin
CFG_2025Q4_1699.original_quote: The call center as an example, we think that combination of modernizing the tech stack for the call center front to back plus introducing voice AI and other mechanisms, we can get in the range over the medium-term outlook 50% of our call center calls out of a human answering them.
CFG_2025Q4_1699.summary: The company is modernizing its call center technology and introducing voice AI, aiming to have 50% of call center calls handled by AI instead of humans over the medium term.

CME_2024Q3_1700.speaker: Terrence Duffy
CME_2024Q3_1700.original_quote: I've mentioned many times that the lines will continue to blur between retail and institutional trading as we advance, especially with the rise of artificial intelligence, technological advancements, and greater access to marketplaces.
CME_2024Q3_1700.summary: The company states that the rise of artificial intelligence and technological advancements will blur the lines between retail and institutional trading as they advance.

KO_2023Q1_1702.speaker: James Quincey

KO_2023Q1_1702.summary: The company partnered with OpenAI and ChatGPT to run a promotion that allowed users to design Coke advertising, which was displayed on a Times Square billboard.

CRWD_2025Q2_1863.speaker: George Kurtz

CRWD_2025Q3_1866.speaker: George Kurtz
CRWD_2025Q3_1866.original_quote: And I covered that a bit in the prepared remarks in the fact that Charlotte AI was built to be something more than a copilot.

CCI_2024Q3_1875.speaker: Daniel Schlanger
CCI_2024Q3_1875.original_quote: So the idea of connecting large AI-focused data centers being built in more rural locations because land costs are cheap and then connecting into the market, into the market, big markets where people are via fiber, we're not interested in building that type of fiber because we don't see that as supp
CCI_2024Q3_1875.summary: CCI is not interested in building fiber connections to connect large AI-focused data centers in rural locations to major markets, as they do not see that as a viable opportunity.

CRWD_2025Q3_1867.speaker: George Kurtz

CRWD_2025Q3_1867.summary: The company has developed an ecosystem that allows workflows to be executed within the Falcon platform, supported by Charlotte AI.

CRWD_2025Q3_1864.speaker: George Kurtz
CRWD_2025Q3_1864.original_quote: Falcon Flex is increasing both our share of wallet and enterprise real estate, furthering CrowdStrike as cybersecurity's AI-native platform of record.
CRWD_2025Q3_1864.summary: CrowdStrike is positioning Falcon Flex as an AI-native platform for cybersecurity, which is enhancing their market share and enterprise presence.

CRWD_2025Q4_1870.speaker: Joel Fishbein
CRWD_2025Q4_1870.original_quote: Thanks for the color around AI and AI strategy in Charlotte.
CRWD_2025Q4_1870.summary: The company is providing insights regarding its AI strategy in Charlotte.

CRWD_2025Q4_1868.speaker: George Kurtz
CRWD_2025Q4_1868.original_quote: Q4 showcases the fruits of our labors, giving me strong conviction in our AI-native single platform, excellent execution, and accelerating market opportunity.
CRWD_2025Q4_1868.summary: The company is showcasing the results of their efforts in developing an AI-native single platform, indicating strong execution and a growing market opportunity.

CRWD_2025Q4_1869.speaker: Burt Podbere
CRWD_2025Q4_1869.original_quote: Falcon Flex momentum is increasing, accelerating platform adoption, and our strong sales execution positions us to extend our market leadership with the AI-native Falcon platform.
CRWD_2025Q4_1869.summary: CRWD is experiencing increasing momentum with Falcon Flex, which is accelerating platform adoption and positioning the company to extend its market leadership with the AI-native Falcon platform.

CRWD_2025Q4_1871.speaker: George Kurtz
CRWD_2025Q4_1871.original_quote: So yeah, I mean, when you look at Charlotte AI and what we've been able to do from an agentic AI perspective, we talked about some of the efficiencies in terms of hours saved.
CRWD_2025Q4_1871.summary: CRWD is utilizing Charlotte AI to achieve efficiencies by saving hours through an agentic AI approach.

CCI_2025Q2_1876.original_quote: First, it's still early, but I'm curious if you have any updated thoughts on how generative AI or AI could increase traffic from your customers and consequently boost tower revenue, especially as inferencing plays a larger role in AI applications.
CCI_2025Q2_1876.summary: The analyst is inquiring about potential impacts of generative AI on customer traffic and tower revenue, particularly as inferencing becomes more significant in AI applications.

CRWD_2025Q4_1872.speaker: George Kurtz
CRWD_2025Q4_1872.original_quote: It leverages, you know, the full base of data that we have in our AI and workflow infrastructure, and we'll continue to give you updates on it because we think it's a real added element to the repertoire of the modules that we have, and we're proud to tell you about the success.
CRWD_2025Q4_1872.summary: The company leverages its full base of data within its AI and workflow infrastructure, and it plans to provide updates on this as it adds value to its existing modules.

CCI_2025Q2_1877.original_quote: The first question on what do we see as incremental data in AI.
CCI_2025Q2_1877.summary: The company is addressing the question of what incremental data they observe in relation to AI.

CMI_2023Q4_1878.summary: CMI is recognizing the data center market as a growth opportunity, particularly due to the increasing demand for cloud services and investments in artificial intelligence.

DDOG_2023Q1_1889.summary: The analyst is inquiring whether the emergence of generative AI workloads is simply a matter of time.

DDOG_2023Q1_1888.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2023Q1_1888.original_quote: Regarding any market share gain moving forward from Microsoft or others, these will likely stem from cloud workloads that gather data for AI models, areas where we are well-positioned to capture business.
DDOG_2023Q1_1888.summary: The company is well-positioned to capture business from cloud workloads that gather data for AI models, which may lead to market share gains from Microsoft and others.

CVS_2023Q2_1879.speaker: Karen Lynch
CVS_2023Q2_1879.original_quote: For example, we’ve been selectively using artificial intelligence for some time and are increasingly finding opportunities to improve the efficiency of our operations, enhance our customer experience, and increase our competitiveness.
CVS_2023Q2_1879.summary: CVS has been selectively using artificial intelligence to improve operational efficiency, enhance customer experience, and increase competitiveness.

DRI_2025Q2_1884.speaker: Raj Vennam
DRI_2025Q2_1884.original_quote: Our cloud-based analytics capability allows us to gain insights and advance analytics, so we're adapting in the wake of AI developments.
DRI_2025Q2_1884.summary: The company is adapting its cloud-based analytics capability to gain insights and advance analytics in response to AI developments.

CVS_2023Q2_1880.speaker: David Joyner
CVS_2023Q2_1880.original_quote: Bottom line, and this speaks to the broader biosimilar marketplace, we’re committed to establishing a viable and durable biosimilar market and believe we’re well positioned to deliver innovation in the AI class, and we look forward to providing more clarity around Humira in the coming weeks.
CVS_2023Q2_1880.summary: CVS is committed to delivering innovation in the AI class within the biosimilar marketplace and is well positioned to do so.

CVS_2024Q1_1881.speaker: Brian Kane
CVS_2024Q1_1881.original_quote: We're actually using a lot of really advanced AI tools to identify those members.
CVS_2024Q1_1881.summary: CVS is using advanced AI tools to identify members.

DDOG_2023Q1_1885.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2023Q1_1885.original_quote: I also want to take a moment to share our excitement for the latest wave of AI innovation.
DDOG_2023Q1_1885.summary: The company is expressing excitement about the latest wave of AI innovation.

DHR_2023Q3_1883.speaker: Rainer Blair
DHR_2023Q3_1883.original_quote: Molecular Devices recently released the CellXpress.ai, an artificial intelligence-driven cell culture system that automates traditionally manual cultivation processes.
DHR_2023Q3_1883.summary: Molecular Devices released the CellXpress.ai, an AI-driven cell culture system that automates manual cultivation processes.

DDOG_2024Q3_1891.speaker: Olivier Pomel

DDOG_2023Q1_1890.speaker: Olivier Pomel

DHR_2023Q2_1882.speaker: Rainer Blair

DHR_2023Q2_1882.summary: IDBS has released Polar Insight, a biopharma data management platform that uses artificial intelligence to assist researchers in analyzing datasets more quickly, thereby accelerating drug discovery, regulatory filings, and technology transfer.

DDOG_2023Q1_1887.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2023Q1_1887.original_quote: It’s a fascinating time with rapid innovations in AI.
DDOG_2023Q1_1887.summary: The company acknowledges the current period as a fascinating time due to rapid innovations in AI.

DDOG_2024Q3_1896.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2024Q3_1896.original_quote: At the same time, we're excited to see what's happening with AI innovation as it transitions from testing and experimenting into real production applications.

DDOG_2024Q3_1892.speaker: David Obstler
DDOG_2024Q3_1892.original_quote: Some of our growth is coming from AI-native customers, who this quarter represented more than 6% of our Q3 ARR, up from more than 4% in Q2 and about 2.5% of our ARR in the year-ago quarter.
DDOG_2024Q3_1892.summary: The company is experiencing growth from AI-native customers, who accounted for over 6% of their Q3 ARR, an increase from more than 4% in Q2 and about 2.5% in the same quarter last year.

DDOG_2024Q3_1903.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2024Q3_1903.original_quote: Firstly, to the product management team for building great products last quarter, to the customers that spent their time with us to ensure those products work right, especially for the new products like LLM observability and On Call.
DDOG_2024Q3_1903.summary: The company is building new products such as LLM observability and On Call, which are likely related to AI capabilities.

DDOG_2024Q4_1904.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2024Q4_1904.original_quote: During 2024, we kept building and innovating as we scaled up our teams and went broader and deeper into the problems we solve for our customers from the cloud to AI.
DDOG_2024Q4_1904.summary: The company is building and innovating as they expand their teams and address customer problems related to cloud and AI.

DDOG_2024Q3_1893.speaker: Mark Murphy

DDOG_2024Q3_1897.summary: The company is reallocating project resources, including time and funds, toward AI as they recognize they are still in the early stages of this lifecycle.

DDOG_2024Q4_1905.speaker: David Obstler
DDOG_2024Q4_1905.original_quote: Next, we continue to see robust contribution from AI native customers who represented about 6% of Q4 ARR, roughly the same as last quarter and up from about 3% of ARR in the year-ago quarter.

DDOG_2024Q4_1906.original_quote: I'm curious how you're feeling overall about the book of business for AI native customers.

DDOG_2024Q3_1895.speaker: Sanjit Singh
DDOG_2024Q3_1895.original_quote: Is that still the theme in terms of driving new bookings, new expansion deals, or are you starting to see customers focused less on the consolidation opportunity, more on innovation and bringing their innovation budgets to bear to invest in AI and cloud, bringing Datadog along for the ride?
DDOG_2024Q3_1895.summary: Customers are increasingly focusing on innovation and allocating their budgets to invest in AI and cloud, with Datadog being part of that investment.

DDOG_2024Q3_1902.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2024Q3_1902.original_quote: We observe classical workloads in the cloud, with very large growth on the AI-native side.

DDOG_2024Q3_1900.speaker: Olivier Pomel

DDOG_2024Q3_1898.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2024Q3_1898.original_quote: Where the workload might have grown more, instead of 20%, they could grow 25%, perhaps some of those 5% are going into AI, which is largely right now in experimentation and model training.
DDOG_2024Q3_1898.summary: The company indicates that a portion of workload growth, potentially 5%, is being allocated to AI, which is currently focused on experimentation and model training.

DDOG_2024Q4_1911.speaker: Olivier Pomel

DDOG_2024Q4_1916.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2024Q4_1916.original_quote: Inside Datadog, what’s intriguing about the current evolution of AI is that it impacts various aspects of our business.

CRWD_2025Q1_1857.speaker: George Kurtz
CRWD_2025Q1_1857.original_quote: As hyperscalers print remarkable results as NVIDIA continues to amaze and as AI hardware spend reaches gold rush levels, estimated to be north of $60 billion in the last 12 months, CrowdStrike is at the epicenter of securing the workloads driving the AI revolution.
CRWD_2025Q1_1857.summary: CrowdStrike is securing the workloads that are driving the AI revolution, as AI hardware spending has reached over $60 billion in the last year.

DDOG_2024Q4_1908.speaker: Mark Murphy
DDOG_2024Q4_1908.original_quote: And they were talking about capacity constraints on the AI side.
DDOG_2024Q4_1908.summary: The company is addressing capacity constraints related to AI operations.

DDOG_2024Q4_1907.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2024Q4_1907.original_quote: In the AI cohort, we observed renewals with increased commitments, improved terms, and optimized usage, which is typical for larger end customers during renewals as they aim to maximize their value.
DDOG_2024Q4_1907.summary: DDOG observed that in the AI cohort, renewals included increased commitments, improved terms, and optimized usage, which is common for larger end customers during renewals to maximize their value.

DDOG_2025Q1_1918.speaker: David Obstler
DDOG_2025Q1_1918.original_quote: We saw a continued rise in contribution from AI native customers who represented about 8.5% of Q1 ARR, up from about 6% of ARR last quarter and up from about 3.5% of ARR in the year-ago quarter.
DDOG_2025Q1_1918.summary: The company reported a rise in contribution from AI native customers, which represented approximately 8.5% of Q1 ARR, an increase from 6% last quarter and 3.5% in the same quarter last year.

DDOG_2024Q3_1894.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2024Q3_1894.original_quote: So there are a few others both on AI lines and other kinds of models.
DDOG_2024Q3_1894.summary: The company is working on AI lines and other types of models.

DDOG_2024Q4_1910.speaker: Raimo Lenschow
DDOG_2024Q4_1910.original_quote: There's a lot of focus on the major AI players right now, but that's just the beginning of the AI opportunity.
DDOG_2024Q4_1910.summary: The company acknowledges the current focus on major AI players and suggests that this is only the beginning of the AI opportunity.

DDOG_2024Q4_1913.speaker: David Obstler
DDOG_2024Q4_1913.original_quote: When considering the contribution from AI, we incorporate that into our discount level.
DDOG_2024Q4_1913.summary: DDOG incorporates AI contributions into their discount level calculations.

DDOG_2025Q1_1921.speaker: Mark Murphy
DDOG_2025Q1_1921.original_quote: The combination of those large AI numbers is incredible.

DDOG_2024Q4_1914.speaker: Eric Heath

DDOG_2024Q4_1914.summary: The analyst is asking Oli for thoughts on Agentic AI and AI in general.

DDOG_2024Q4_1912.summary: The quote inquires whether the company's guidance expects a steady contribution from digital and AI aspects over the year.

DDOG_2024Q4_1915.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2024Q4_1915.original_quote: However, we have noticed that when we began developing our LLM Observability product, most customer use cases were centered around chatbots or RAG, where the aim was to access and return information.
DDOG_2024Q4_1915.summary: The company is developing an LLM Observability product, with most customer use cases focused on chatbots or retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) for accessing and returning information.

DDOG_2025Q1_1919.speaker: Mark Murphy

DDOG_2025Q1_1919.summary: The quote mentions that the CEO of Anthropic predicts that AI will be responsible for writing 100% of all code within the next 12 to 18 months.

DDOG_2025Q1_1917.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2025Q1_1917.original_quote: At the end of Q1, more than 4,000 customers used one or more Datadog AI integrations, and this number has doubled year-over-year.
DDOG_2025Q1_1917.summary: Datadog has over 4,000 customers using its AI integrations, which has doubled compared to the same time last year.

DDOG_2025Q2_1932.speaker: David M. Obstler
DDOG_2025Q2_1932.original_quote: This is not a comment about AI.
DDOG_2025Q2_1932.summary: The executive explicitly states that the comment is not related to AI.

DDOG_2025Q2_1930.speaker: Sanjit Kumar Singh
DDOG_2025Q2_1930.original_quote: Considering your comments about the AI native cohort potentially facing volatility, I’m trying to reconcile that with such strong guidance.
DDOG_2025Q2_1930.summary: The analyst is trying to reconcile the strong guidance provided by the company with the potential volatility faced by the AI native cohort.

DDOG_2025Q2_1931.speaker: David M. Obstler
DDOG_2025Q2_1931.original_quote: We provided metrics showing that the AI cohort is growing rapidly and we are gaining significant market share in that area.
DDOG_2025Q2_1931.summary: The company is providing metrics that indicate rapid growth in their AI cohort and significant market share gains in that area.

DDOG_2025Q1_1920.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2025Q1_1920.original_quote: We see the rise of AI-written code.
DDOG_2025Q1_1920.summary: The company sees an increase in AI-written code.

CCI_2024Q3_1874.speaker: Steven Moskowitz
CCI_2024Q3_1874.original_quote: Demand drivers, including from AI, suggest that the need for data transport will continue to rise, and our connection hubs in major cities are well positioned to meet this demand.
CCI_2024Q3_1874.summary: CCI indicates that demand drivers, particularly from AI, are expected to increase the need for data transport, and their connection hubs in major cities are strategically positioned to address this demand.

DDOG_2025Q2_1934.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2025Q2_1934.original_quote: We believe there is significant potential in automation through autonomous AI agents.
DDOG_2025Q2_1934.summary: The company believes there is significant potential in automation through autonomous AI agents.

DDOG_2025Q2_1933.speaker: Mark Ronald Murphy
DDOG_2025Q2_1933.original_quote: It looks like you're bringing very serious AI research to a space where it is applicable and opening it up very broadly, the size of the dataset is vast.
DDOG_2025Q2_1933.summary: DDOG is conducting serious AI research in a broadly applicable space, utilizing a vast dataset.

DDOG_2025Q1_1924.speaker: Kash Rangan
DDOG_2025Q1_1924.original_quote: Oli, when you look at the AI market, certainly, it looks like we're about to move from training into inference.
DDOG_2025Q1_1924.summary: The company is observing a shift in the AI market from training models to focusing on inference capabilities.

DDOG_2025Q1_1923.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2025Q1_1923.original_quote: However, we now realize that this field is evolving into a significant enabler for building AI workloads, or conversely, a hindrance if not approached correctly.
DDOG_2025Q1_1923.summary: The company acknowledges that the field is evolving into a significant enabler for building AI workloads, but it can also be a hindrance if not approached correctly.

DDOG_2025Q1_1925.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2025Q1_1925.original_quote: We have created an LLM observability product that is seeing increasing adoption from customers as they transition to production.
DDOG_2025Q1_1925.summary: DDOG has created an LLM observability product that is experiencing growing adoption from customers moving to production.

DDOG_2025Q2_1926.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2025Q2_1926.original_quote: They include more than a dozen that are spending over $1 million a year with us and more than 80 who are spending more than $100,000, and they include 8 of the top 10 leading AI companies.
DDOG_2025Q2_1926.summary: The company reports that it has more than a dozen clients spending over $1 million annually, including 8 of the top 10 leading AI companies.

DDOG_2025Q1_1922.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2025Q1_1922.original_quote: It's not really trending up, not trending down right now, but we see the same desire from customers to move more into the cloud and to lay the groundwork so they can also adopt AI because digital transformation and cloud migrations are prerequisites for that.
DDOG_2025Q1_1922.summary: The company sees a desire from customers to move more into the cloud and lay the groundwork for adopting AI, indicating that digital transformation and cloud migrations are prerequisites for AI adoption.

DDOG_2025Q2_1935.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2025Q2_1935.original_quote: The one thing I would add, which is that we also are spending more on AI training and inference in R&D if you compare to past years in R&D, and the output of that is things such as Toto or the next versions of it that we're training right now and experiments we're running to train agents, run simula
DDOG_2025Q2_1935.summary: The company is increasing its spending on AI training and inference in R&D compared to previous years, leading to developments like Toto and ongoing experiments to train agents.

DDOG_2025Q2_1937.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2025Q2_1937.original_quote: This sector requires us to address essential foundational features while also investing in future innovations, particularly as AI is transforming the landscape.
DDOG_2025Q2_1937.summary: The company is investing in future innovations as AI is transforming the landscape of their sector while addressing essential foundational features.

DDOG_2025Q2_1936.speaker: Koji Ikeda
DDOG_2025Q2_1936.original_quote: How are you feeling about contract visibility, specifically with your large AI native customers?
DDOG_2025Q2_1936.summary: The analyst is inquiring about the company's contract visibility with large customers that are native to AI.

DDOG_2025Q2_1940.speaker: Michael Joseph Cikos
DDOG_2025Q2_1940.original_quote: Is it reasonable to compare traditional enterprises using CPUs with AI-focused companies that are increasing their investments in GPUs?
DDOG_2025Q2_1940.summary: The quote questions the reasonableness of comparing traditional enterprises that utilize CPUs with AI-focused companies that are investing more in GPUs.

DDOG_2025Q3_1946.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2025Q3_1946.original_quote: As an illustration of growth and adoption in the past few months, the number of LLM span customers sending to Datadog has more than quadrupled.
DDOG_2025Q3_1946.summary: Datadog has seen the number of LLM span customers sending data to its platform more than quadruple in recent months, indicating significant growth and adoption.

DDOG_2025Q3_1949.speaker: Sanjit Singh
DDOG_2025Q3_1949.original_quote: And just as a follow-up on the AI observability opportunity.
DDOG_2025Q3_1949.summary: The company is following up on the AI observability opportunity.

DDOG_2025Q2_1939.speaker: David M. Obstler
DDOG_2025Q2_1939.original_quote: I would say like we talked about last quarter, this isn't about the AI and margins, the AI cohort versus non-AI cohorts.
DDOG_2025Q2_1939.summary: The company is indicating that the discussion is not focused on the differences in margins between AI and non-AI cohorts.

DDOG_2025Q2_1938.speaker: Karl Emil Keirstead
DDOG_2025Q2_1938.original_quote: So David, now that the AI natives are 11% of Datadog's revenue mix, I think it's fair to ask whether the revenues from that cohort are coming at similar margins as the rest of the business?
DDOG_2025Q2_1938.summary: Datadog's AI-native products account for 11% of the company's revenue mix, prompting a question about whether these revenues have similar margins to the rest of the business.

DDOG_2025Q2_1944.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2025Q2_1944.original_quote: So I mean the initial response to the AI agents is really pretty positive.
DDOG_2025Q2_1944.summary: The company is receiving a positive initial response to its AI agents.

DDOG_2025Q2_1942.speaker: Jacob Roberge
DDOG_2025Q2_1942.original_quote: There's obviously been a lot of talk about AI natives around the business.
DDOG_2025Q2_1942.summary: The company acknowledges the significant discussion surrounding AI natives in the business sector.

DDOG_2025Q2_1943.speaker: Jacob Roberge
DDOG_2025Q2_1943.original_quote: That's helpful, and then could you also talk about the uptake and feedback that you're getting for your own AI solutions like Bits AI, the new observability agents?
DDOG_2025Q2_1943.summary: The company is receiving feedback and observing uptake for its AI solutions, specifically Bits AI and the new observability agents.

DDOG_2025Q2_1941.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2025Q2_1941.original_quote: Today, however, AI-native companies and enterprises are distinct entities.
DDOG_2025Q2_1941.summary: The company states that AI-native companies and enterprises are currently recognized as distinct entities.

DDOG_2025Q2_1945.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2025Q2_1945.original_quote: We're consuming more AI training inference, which is changing the balance between human tasks and those handled by GPUs.
DDOG_2025Q2_1945.summary: The company is consuming more AI training inference, which is altering the balance between tasks performed by humans and those managed by GPUs.

CTVA_2023Q1_1823.speaker: Chuck Magro
CTVA_2023Q1_1823.original_quote: We are planning on completing about 85% of our 32 planned country exits and about 60% of our AI exits by the end of this year.
CTVA_2023Q1_1823.summary: The company is planning to complete about 60% of its AI exits by the end of this year.

CTVA_2025Q3_1825.speaker: Vincent Andrews
CTVA_2025Q3_1825.original_quote: Chuck, do you think there's any further pruning of the AI portfolio that you want to do?
CTVA_2025Q3_1825.summary: The analyst is inquiring about potential further pruning of the AI portfolio.

DDOG_2025Q3_1947.speaker: David Obstler
DDOG_2025Q3_1947.original_quote: In addition, we now have more larger AI customers, including 15 of them spending $1 million or more annually with Datadog and about 100 spending more than $100,000 annually.
DDOG_2025Q3_1947.summary: Datadog has acquired more larger AI customers, with 15 customers spending over $1 million annually and about 100 customers spending more than $100,000 annually.

DDOG_2025Q3_1948.speaker: Sanjit Singh
DDOG_2025Q3_1948.original_quote: Is there sort of an uplift in sort of the cloud migration trends as you're starting to see enterprises build more AI applications?
DDOG_2025Q3_1948.summary: The quote inquires about potential increases in cloud migration trends as enterprises begin to develop more AI applications.

DDOG_2025Q3_1954.speaker: Fatima Boolani
DDOG_2025Q3_1954.original_quote: So how do you just broader advancements in AI help beef up and/or detract your ability to monetize this product?
DDOG_2025Q3_1954.summary: The quote asks how broader advancements in AI impact the company's ability to monetize its product.

DDOG_2025Q3_1953.speaker: Mark Murphy
DDOG_2025Q3_1953.original_quote: You had mentioned the expansion of the contract with your largest AI native customer, and I believe you said better economics for a higher commitment.
DDOG_2025Q3_1953.summary: The company is expanding its contract with its largest AI native customer, resulting in better economics for a higher commitment.

DDOG_2025Q3_1950.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2025Q3_1950.original_quote: Additionally, we feel that AI capabilities cannot be separated from non-AI components of the business.
DDOG_2025Q3_1950.summary: The company believes that AI capabilities are integrated with non-AI components of the business and cannot be separated.

DDOG_2025Q3_1951.speaker: Raimo Lenschow
DDOG_2025Q3_1951.original_quote: On the AI front, without focusing on any particular customer, the fact that there are 15 customers contributing over a million is significant, and over 100 with contributions exceeding 100,000 is impressive.
DDOG_2025Q3_1951.summary: The company highlights that there are 15 customers contributing over a million and more than 100 customers contributing over 100,000 in relation to AI.

DDOG_2025Q2_1927.speaker: David M. Obstler
DDOG_2025Q2_1927.original_quote: We saw a continued rise in contribution from AI native customers in the quarter who represented about 11% of Q2 revenues, up from 8% of revenues in the last quarter and about 4% of revenues in the year-ago quarter.
DDOG_2025Q2_1927.summary: DDOG reported a continued increase in revenue contribution from AI native customers, which accounted for 11% of Q2 revenues, up from 8% in the previous quarter and 4% in the same quarter last year.

DDOG_2025Q3_1961.speaker: Ryan MacWilliams
DDOG_2025Q3_1961.original_quote: On the large AI contract expansion that you provided commentary on, is there any way we can think about the contribution change from this customer over the next few quarters?
DDOG_2025Q3_1961.summary: The quote asks about the contribution change from a large AI contract expansion mentioned by the company, seeking insights on its impact over the next few quarters.

DDOG_2025Q3_1952.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2025Q3_1952.original_quote: They may not have started as AI-focused but have quickly adapted to growth in the AI sector.
DDOG_2025Q3_1952.summary: The company has quickly adapted to growth in the AI sector, even though they may not have started as AI-focused.

DECK_2024Q2_1966.speaker: Dave Powers
DECK_2024Q2_1966.original_quote: We have some work to do there, but we want to be providing our teams with the right level of visibility so they can run their businesses effectively and leverage AI technologies coming down the pike and then continue to heavily invest in marketing.
DECK_2024Q2_1966.summary: The company aims to provide its teams with better visibility to run their businesses effectively while leveraging upcoming AI technologies and continuing to invest in marketing.

DDOG_2025Q3_1956.speaker: Eric Heath
DDOG_2025Q3_1956.original_quote: Oli, David, Bits AI seems like a really exciting thing out of Dash.
DDOG_2025Q3_1956.summary: The quote mentions that Bits AI is an exciting development coming from Dash.

DDOG_2025Q3_1955.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2025Q3_1955.original_quote: We believed that with AI, particularly, we could achieve capabilities throughout the whole cycle that wouldn’t be possible otherwise.
DDOG_2025Q3_1955.summary: The company believes that AI can enable capabilities throughout the entire cycle that would not be achievable otherwise.

DDOG_2025Q3_1958.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2025Q3_1958.original_quote: The biggest surprise has been that AI adoption has grown more rapidly than we anticipated at the start of the year.
DDOG_2025Q3_1958.summary: The company has observed that AI adoption has increased more quickly than they expected at the beginning of the year.

DELL_2025Q2_1970.speaker: Jeff Clarke
DELL_2025Q2_1970.original_quote: We shipped $3.1 billion of AI servers in Q2.
DELL_2025Q2_1970.summary: DELL shipped $3.1 billion of AI servers in Q2.

DDOG_2025Q3_1962.speaker: David Obstler
DDOG_2025Q3_1962.original_quote: And when we look at it, it's not just an AI SMB.
DDOG_2025Q3_1962.summary: The company states that it is not solely focused on AI for small and medium businesses (SMBs).

DDOG_2025Q3_1965.speaker: Olivier Pomel
DDOG_2025Q3_1965.original_quote: The Bits AI Agent has a significant growth potential for our customers.
DDOG_2025Q3_1965.summary: DDOG is highlighting the significant growth potential of the Bits AI Agent for their customers.

DDOG_2025Q3_1964.speaker: Jacob Roberge
DDOG_2025Q3_1964.original_quote: And then just on the new Bits AI Agents, can you just talk about the early feedback that you've gotten for those solutions and maybe how the engagement with those agents compares to kind of the ramp of security Flex Logs?
DDOG_2025Q3_1964.summary: DDOG is discussing early feedback on their new Bits AI Agents and comparing the engagement with these agents to the ramp of their security Flex Logs.

DELL_2023Q2_1968.speaker: Jeff Clarke
DELL_2023Q2_1968.original_quote: Similar trend in servers, if you think about the growth of our ASPs over time in servers, they’ve expanded, driven by our ability to drive richer content, by selling deeper into the data center, selling higher value workload solutions around GPUs as an example, driving artificial intelligence-relate
DELL_2023Q2_1968.summary: DELL is expanding its average selling prices (ASPs) in servers by providing richer content and selling higher value workload solutions, particularly around GPUs related to artificial intelligence.

DDOG_2025Q3_1963.speaker: Karl Keirstead
DDOG_2025Q3_1963.original_quote: Some of the very large AI natives are beginning to diversify to utilizing Oracle's OCI and Stargate.
DDOG_2025Q3_1963.summary: Some large AI-native companies are starting to diversify by using Oracle's OCI and Stargate.

DELL_2023Q4_1969.speaker: Chuck Whitten
DELL_2023Q4_1969.original_quote: We launched our next generation of PowerEdge servers with significantly enhanced AI and machine learning capabilities and improved energy and cost efficiency for data center, cloud and edge environments, including new purpose-built XR servers for telecom, open RAN and mobile edge use cases.
DELL_2023Q4_1969.summary: DELL launched its next generation of PowerEdge servers that feature significantly enhanced AI and machine learning capabilities, along with improved energy and cost efficiency for various environments, including new purpose-built XR servers for telecom and mobile edge use cases.

DELL_2025Q2_1971.speaker: Yvonne McGill

DELL_2025Q2_1977.speaker: Jeff Clarke
DELL_2025Q2_1977.original_quote: Over the past 12 months, we delivered $6.5 billion worth of AI infrastructure to our customers against a demand of just under $9.5 billion.
DELL_2025Q2_1977.summary: DELL delivered $6.5 billion worth of AI infrastructure to customers over the past 12 months, responding to a demand of just under $9.5 billion.

DELL_2025Q2_1981.summary: The quote mentions the demand for AI servers from enterprise customers as observed by the speaker.

DELL_2025Q2_1980.speaker: Jeff Clarke
DELL_2025Q2_1980.original_quote: We have an aging installed base of machines bought during the COVID era, all mounting to be refreshed with exciting new products built around AI and more AI applications are coming.
DELL_2025Q2_1980.summary: DELL is refreshing its aging installed base of machines with new products built around AI, and more AI applications are forthcoming.

DELL_2025Q2_1974.speaker: Jeff Clarke
DELL_2025Q2_1974.original_quote: And the second one, which I think is very important, we improved margins of our AI portfolio.

DELL_2025Q2_1976.speaker: Yvonne McGill
DELL_2025Q2_1976.original_quote: CSG is expected to grow at 14%, while ISG is set to see a significant increase of 30% year-over-year, driven mainly by AI servers and ongoing strength in traditional servers.
DELL_2025Q2_1976.summary: DELL expects its Infrastructure Solutions Group (ISG) to grow by 30% year-over-year, primarily driven by AI servers.

DELL_2025Q2_1973.speaker: Yvonne McGill
DELL_2025Q2_1973.original_quote: And in AI servers, we had strong shipments with improved profitability and growing enterprise customers in that portfolio mix.

DELL_2025Q2_1972.speaker: Amit Daryanani
DELL_2025Q2_1972.original_quote: They could increase from 8% in Q1 to 11% this quarter, even with the 82% sequential growth you experienced in AI servers.

DELL_2025Q2_1975.summary: The analyst is asking Jeff for an update on the development of AI server margins and insights regarding the flat backlog from the previous quarter.

DDOG_2025Q3_1959.original_quote: When we examine the situation, it's not solely an AI-driven phenomenon.

DDOG_2025Q3_1960.summary: The quote mentions gross profit dollar acceleration and improved unit economics for the largest customer, but does not provide specific information about AI.

DELL_2025Q2_1978.summary: DELL is providing details about its AI optimized server customer base, which includes an increasing number of enterprises and an expanding pipeline in Tier-2 CSPs.

DDOG_2025Q3_1957.speaker: Olivier Pomel

DELL_2025Q2_1979.summary: The analyst inquires about the improvement in profitability of AI servers from Q1 to Q2, specifically asking whether the gross profit percentage significantly improved or if the increase in operating profit was due to reduced operating expenses.

DELL_2025Q2_1982.speaker: Jeff Clarke

DELL_2025Q2_1984.speaker: Yvonne McGill
DELL_2025Q2_1984.original_quote: So that would imply that AI servers are down quarter-over-quarter.

DELL_2025Q2_1989.speaker: David Vogt

DELL_2025Q2_1985.speaker: Jeff Clarke
DELL_2025Q2_1985.original_quote: Customers, particularly those in enterprise, whether large or small, are looking to integrate AI capabilities but often lack the necessary space; they need to make room for new AI technology.
DELL_2025Q2_1985.summary: Customers, especially in the enterprise sector, are seeking to integrate AI capabilities but often do not have the required space to accommodate new AI technology.

DELL_2025Q2_1990.speaker: Yvonne McGill
DELL_2025Q2_1990.original_quote: And we expect AI momentum to continue and we expect, as we talked about a little bit previously, the CSG business to grow also.

DELL_2025Q2_1992.speaker: Jeff Clarke
DELL_2025Q2_1992.original_quote: Again, these large language models consume lots of data, and they need it fast.

DELL_2025Q3_1994.speaker: Yvonne McGill

DELL_2025Q3_1993.speaker: Jeff Clarke
DELL_2025Q3_1993.original_quote: We shipped $2.9 billion of AI servers in Q3, resulting in AI server backlog of $4.5 billion.

DELL_2025Q2_1988.speaker: Jeff Clarke

DELL_2025Q2_1988.summary: Dell is acknowledging that customers are seeking opportunities to integrate AI into their infrastructure.

DELL_2025Q3_1995.speaker: Yvonne McGill
DELL_2025Q3_1995.original_quote: It's encouraging to see customers concentrating on consolidation and power efficiency by modernizing their data centers, which also creates space for AI infrastructure.

DELL_2025Q3_1996.original_quote: And I'm wondering what has changed in terms of coming up weaker than your expectations, especially in light of the fact that it sounds like the AI pipeline is really strong.

DELL_2025Q3_1997.speaker: Jeff Clarke
DELL_2025Q3_1997.original_quote: And the second element that we reflect in that annual guidance or specifically in Q4 is the shift in demand in AI to Blackwell.

DELL_2025Q3_2000.speaker: David Vogt
DELL_2025Q3_2000.original_quote: So not to beat a dead horse in AI, I want to try a different topic.

DELL_2025Q3_1998.speaker: Yvonne McGill
DELL_2025Q3_1998.original_quote: PCs, it's not a matter of if the repurchase is going to happen, it's when, and we're seeing that move more into next year and then the unpredictability of the AI shipments.
DELL_2025Q3_1998.summary: Dell is observing a shift in PC repurchase timing, with a focus on the unpredictability of AI shipments impacting their business.

DELL_2025Q3_1999.speaker: Aaron Rakers
DELL_2025Q3_1999.original_quote: Kind of sticking on the theme of the AI server dynamics.
DELL_2025Q3_1999.summary: The quote mentions the theme of AI server dynamics, indicating a focus on the developments and trends related to AI servers.

DELL_2025Q3_2004.speaker: Wamsi Mohan
DELL_2025Q3_2004.original_quote: Last quarter just as a quick clarification, last quarter you noted AI revenues would be down quarter-on-quarter in 3Q.
DELL_2025Q3_2004.summary: The company noted that AI revenues would be down quarter-on-quarter in the third quarter.

DELL_2025Q3_2011.speaker: Jeff Clarke
DELL_2025Q3_2011.original_quote: It's a larger portion of the pipeline, and we're only in the very, very early innings of enterprises figuring out how to deploy AI.
DELL_2025Q3_2011.summary: Dell indicates that AI is becoming a larger part of their pipeline and that enterprises are still in the early stages of learning how to deploy AI.

DELL_2025Q3_2012.speaker: Mehdi Hosseini
DELL_2025Q3_2012.original_quote: Jeff, I want to get your thoughts as your key customer migrates AI platform from Hopper to Blackwell.
DELL_2025Q3_2012.summary: The quote mentions a key customer migrating their AI platform from Hopper to Blackwell.

DELL_2025Q3_2013.speaker: Krish Sankar
DELL_2025Q3_2013.original_quote: But is it the last five quarters you shipped about $9 billion in AI server revenues?
DELL_2025Q3_2013.summary: The company shipped about $9 billion in AI server revenues over the last five quarters.

DELL_2025Q3_2005.speaker: Yvonne McGill
DELL_2025Q3_2005.original_quote: I can provide some insights on our Q4 guidance, which considers the mix within AI, and we anticipate that margins will remain relatively stable.
DELL_2025Q3_2005.summary: DELL anticipates that margins will remain relatively stable, taking into account the mix within AI for their Q4 guidance.

DELL_2025Q3_2014.speaker: Jeff Clarke
DELL_2025Q3_2014.summary: The executive questions whether something is specific to AI.

DELL_2025Q3_2003.speaker: Jeff Clarke
DELL_2025Q3_2003.original_quote: Look, we're pretty excited about the opportunity in AI to expand beyond the individual node.
DELL_2025Q3_2003.summary: Dell is excited about the opportunity in AI to expand beyond the individual node.

DELL_2025Q3_2001.speaker: Jeff Clarke
DELL_2025Q3_2001.original_quote: With respect to the AI pipeline that I referred to, it does not have a sizable sovereign component to it.
DELL_2025Q3_2001.summary: Dell mentions that the AI pipeline they are referring to does not have a significant sovereign component.

DELL_2025Q3_2002.speaker: Erik Woodring
DELL_2025Q3_2002.original_quote: So, Jeff, earlier this year, there was a belief that AI server sales would pull forward some storage and services demand.
DELL_2025Q3_2002.summary: DELL noted that earlier in the year, there was a belief that AI server sales would lead to increased demand for storage and services.

DELL_2025Q3_2015.speaker: Krish Sankar
DELL_2025Q3_2015.summary: The company is confirming that a particular aspect or product is specifically related to AI.

DELL_2025Q3_2016.speaker: Jeff Clarke
DELL_2025Q3_2016.original_quote: I mean, I think I've said publicly multiple times that the AI opportunity for storage is immense simply because GPUs devour data.
DELL_2025Q3_2016.summary: DELL acknowledges that the AI opportunity for storage is significant due to the high data consumption by GPUs.

DELL_2025Q3_2006.speaker: Jeff Clarke
DELL_2025Q3_2006.original_quote: Wamsi, regarding your question about AI shipments in Q4, our guidance reflects the backlog that will be cleared in the quarter, as Blackwell is now in production and increasing our capacity to convert that into shipments.

DELL_2025Q4_2024.speaker: Yvonne McGill
DELL_2025Q4_2024.original_quote: If I look at ISG, which I think some of your question is coming from, we expect that to be in the high teens, fueled by that $15 billion of AI server shipments that we referred to as well as continued growth in both traditional server and storage, I'd say with storage in the low single digits.

DELL_2023Q1_1967.speaker: Jeff Clarke
DELL_2023Q1_1967.original_quote: We're taking on more high-value workloads, our GPU or AI accelerator of growth rate was very strong in the quarter, and that's continued to bolster the performance of our server business.
DELL_2023Q1_1967.summary: DELL is experiencing strong growth in its GPU or AI accelerator segment, which is positively impacting the performance of its server business.

DELL_2025Q3_2019.speaker: Jeff Clarke
DELL_2025Q3_2019.original_quote: PowerScale, as I just talked about is an essential asset and capability that we want to drive and will continue to drive around the unstructured data side and AI.

DELL_2025Q3_2020.speaker: Tim Long
DELL_2025Q3_2020.original_quote: Just wanted to get back to the AI servers and profitability.

DELL_2025Q4_2025.speaker: Erik Woodring

DOW_2023Q2_2109.speaker: Jim Fitterling

DD_2023Q4_2119.speaker: Ed Breen

DD_2023Q4_2123.speaker: Ed Breen

DUK_2024Q4_2116.speaker: Brian Savoy
DUK_2024Q4_2116.original_quote: And over the past many years, leveraging technology, including AI, process improvement, and our scale to drive our costs to where they are, and you're recognizing that, and thank you for that.

DUK_2024Q4_2114.original_quote: They're looking at the fact that these efficiencies may actually increase the demand for AI.

DD_2024Q1_2125.speaker: Edward Breen

DD_2024Q2_2129.speaker: Antonella Franzen

ETN_2025Q3_2157.summary: The company states that the chips used to power AI models and high-performance computing applications are becoming increasingly powerful.

DD_2024Q3_2139.speaker: Lori Koch

ETN_2025Q3_2159.original_quote: On your specific question about dollars per megawatt, our range was between $1.2 million to $2.4 million per megawatt, with the lower end being cloud and the higher end for AI loads for the portfolio we have today.

ETN_2025Q4_2162.speaker: Paulo Ruiz Sternadt
ETN_2025Q4_2162.summary: The company reports that 30% of their offerings were related to AI.

EBAY_2024Q1_2174.speaker: Jamie Iannone

EBAY_2024Q1_2177.speaker: Jamie Iannone

EBAY_2023Q4_2169.original_quote: But more importantly, the benefit of being able to take our 30 years of really rich data of e-commerce and combine that in a hybrid sense, in some cases with open-source LLMs.

EBAY_2023Q4_2172.original_quote: Yes, look, the expansiveness of our marketplace is what allows us to really go after launching compelling Gen AI features.

EPAM_2025Q2_2276.original_quote: It is changing as we go, and we continue to see how we can best adapt to our client needs and also be able to really capture the benefits of our AI and share those benefits with our customers.
EPAM_2025Q2_2276.summary: EPAM is adapting to client needs and capturing the benefits of their AI to share with customers.

EXR_2024Q4_2403.original_quote: So we want to be cautious with AI applications and, you know, not necessarily be a pioneer.

EXPE_2023Q4_2376.speaker: Peter Kern
EXPE_2023Q4_2376.original_quote: It’s really machine learning and AI plumbed into essentially the entire product experience, because what that gets you is effectively a personalized experience for every customer and that's from the front end basic shopping flows as I mentioned to post-booking to CRM and everything else and the more
EXPE_2023Q4_2376.summary: The company is integrating machine learning and AI throughout the entire product experience to provide a personalized experience for every customer, covering aspects from shopping flows to post-booking and CRM.

FFIV_2023Q3_2411.summary: The company emphasizes that capabilities in AI and machine learning are essential for succeeding in API security, alongside effective attack mitigation strategies.

XOM_2023Q4_2404.speaker: Kathy Mikells
XOM_2023Q4_2404.original_quote: So things like how we use artificial intelligence and chatbots in our customer care centers, right, which gives our customers better service.

FFIV_2023Q4_2415.speaker: Francois Locoh-Donou
FFIV_2023Q4_2415.original_quote: Regarding AI's role in our business, the portfolio we are developing—comprising hardware, software, and SaaS—will enable our customers to secure and deliver their APIs and applications across various environments.
FFIV_2023Q4_2415.summary: The company is developing a portfolio that includes hardware, software, and SaaS to help customers secure and deliver their APIs and applications in different environments.

XOM_2024Q3_2405.summary: The analyst is inquiring whether any of the cost savings are attributed to internal AI efforts or if they are solely due to logistics improvements.

XOM_2024Q3_2406.speaker: Darren Woods
XOM_2024Q3_2406.original_quote: I'll start with the end of your question, which is my expectation is there's more to come in this space and I'll talk to AI more specifically, but I would just context it more broadly in that, if you look at the transformational change that we've been making across the entire enterprise, we're very
XOM_2024Q3_2406.summary: The company is expecting more developments in the AI space as part of its broader transformational changes across the enterprise.

XOM_2024Q3_2407.speaker: Kathy Mikells
XOM_2024Q3_2407.original_quote: And I'd certainly say if I take one step up from AI and just talk about technology more broadly and especially information technology, that's a space where we continue to have a lot of opportunity.
